[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m0x4e[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x41[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x4d[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x45[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x53[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x20[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x23[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x61[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x61[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x61[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x61[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x61[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x61[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x61[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x61[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x61[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x6[0m [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [39m,[0m[1;36m0x65[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x6c[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x6c[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0x6f[0m[39m,[0m[1;36m0xa[0m[39m,[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mNAMES [0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m#aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39maaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa,#hello\[0m[1;36m012[0m                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39msubprocess command returned a non-zero exit status: [0m[1;36m1[0m                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mINFO:__main__:Running: docker run --privileged --shm-[0m[33msize[0m[39m=[0m[35m2g[0m[39m --platform linux/amd64[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m--rm -i -e [0m[33mHELPER[0m[39m=[0m[3;92mTrue[0m[39m -e [0m[33mARCHITECTURE[0m[39m=[0m[35mx86_64[0m[39m -v [0m                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [35m/home/qqor/crete/packages/python_oss_fuzz/.oss_fuzz/build/out/[0m[95mwireshark[0m[39m:[0m[35m/[0m[95mout[0m[39m -v [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [35m/tmp/[0m[95mtmp80lrqsko[0m[39m:[0m[35m/[0m[95mtestcase[0m[39m -t ghcr.io/aixcc-finals/base-runner:v1.[0m[1;36m3.0[0m[39m reproduce [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mhandler_irc -[0m[33mruns[0m[39m=[0m[1;36m100[0m[39m.[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m===Evaluation [0m[33mReport[0m[39m===[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m# Evaluation Report[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m## Summary[0m                                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mA heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability has been detected in the Wireshark IRC [0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mprotocol dissector [0m[1;39m([0m[39m`packet-irc.c`[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m during fuzzing tests. The issue manifests as a [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m132[0m[39m-byte write operation that overflows a [0m[1;36m51[0m[39m-byte heap-allocated buffer by writing [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3[0m[39m bytes beyond the allocated region. This occurs in the `dissect_irc_names` [0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mfunction when processing IRC NAMES commands with specific channel parameters.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m## Description[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m### Vulnerability Type[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThe issue is classified as a **heap-buffer-overflow** vulnerability with a [0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mSCARINESS score of [0m[1;36m45[0m[39m, specifically described as a [0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [32m"multi-byte-write-heap-buffer-overflow"[0m[39m. This is a memory corruption vulnerability [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mwhere data is written beyond the bounds of an allocated heap buffer.[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m### Technical Details[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m**Location of the Overflow:**[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- The overflow occurs at address `[0m[1;36m0x5060001c64f3[0m[39m`, which is precisely at the end of[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39ma [0m[1;36m51[0m[39m-byte region allocated from `[0m[1;36m0x5060001c64c0[0m[39m` to `[0m[1;36m0x5060001c64f3[0m[39m`[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- The write operation attempts to copy [0m[1;36m132[0m[39m bytes into this buffer, resulting in [0m[1;36m81[0m[39m [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mbytes [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m132[0m[39m - [0m[1;36m51[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m being written beyond the allocated region[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- The overflow is detected as writing [0m[1;36m3[0m[39m bytes past the buffer boundary [0m[1;39m([0m[39mindicated [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mby shadow byte `[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;36m03[0m[1;39m][0m[39m` in the memory dump[0m[1;39m)[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m**Call Chain:**[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThe vulnerability is triggered through the following execution path:[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1[0m[39m. `dissect_irc` [0m[1;39m([0m[39mpacket-irc.[0m[1;92mc:1114[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m - Main IRC dissection entry point[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2[0m[39m. `dissect_irc_request` [0m[1;39m([0m[39mpacket-irc.[0m[1;92mc:811[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m - Processes IRC request messages[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3[0m[39m. `dissect_irc_request_command` [0m[1;39m([0m[39mpacket-irc.[0m[1;92mc:702[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m - Handles specific IRC commands[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m4[0m[39m. `dissect_irc_names` [0m[1;39m([0m[39mpacket-irc.[0m[1;92mc:563[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m - Processes NAMES command, where the [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39moverflow occurs[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m5[0m[39m. `tvb_memcpy` [0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvbuff.[0m[1;92mc:945[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m - Performs the actual memory copy operation[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m6[0m[39m. `memcpy` - The low-level memory copy where the overflow is detected[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m**Memory Operations:**[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- **Allocation:** The [0m[1;36m51[0m[39m-byte buffer is allocated at `dissect_irc_names` [0m[1;39m([0m[39mline [0m[1;36m537[0m[1;39m)[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39musing `malloc`[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- **Overflow:** The buffer overflow occurs during a `memcpy` operation at [0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`dissect_irc_names` [0m[1;39m([0m[39mline [0m[1;36m563[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m via `tvb_memcpy`[0m                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m**Triggering Input:**[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThe fuzzer generated an input that triggers this vulnerability:[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mNAMES [0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m#aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39maaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa,#hello\n[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThis input consists of:[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- The IRC NAMES command[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- A channel name starting with [0m[32m'#'[0m[39m followed by [0m[1;36m125[0m[39m [0m[32m'a'[0m[39m characters[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- A comma separator[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- Another channel name [0m[32m"#hello"[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- A newline character[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m### Areas for Investigation[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mTo gain a comprehensive understanding of this vulnerability, the following code [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mareas should be examined:[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1[0m[39m. **Primary Location - `epan/dissectors/packet-irc.c`:**[0m                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - The `dissect_irc_names` function [0m[1;39m([0m[39maround line [0m[1;36m537[0m[39m for allocation and line [0m[1;36m563[0m[39m [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mfor the overflow[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Buffer size calculation logic for IRC channel names[0m                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Input validation and bounds checking in the NAMES command handler[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - The `dissect_irc_request_command` function [0m[1;39m([0m[39mline [0m[1;36m702[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m that calls into [0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`dissect_irc_names`[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2[0m[39m. **Supporting Functions:**[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - `epan/tvbuff.c` - The `tvb_memcpy` function [0m[1;39m([0m[39mline [0m[1;36m945[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m to understand buffer [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mcopy operations[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Any helper functions in `packet-irc.c` that process channel names or [0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mcomma-separated lists[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3[0m[39m. **Protocol Handling:**[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - IRC protocol specification requirements for channel name length limits[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - How the dissector handles multiple channel names in a single NAMES command[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Input parsing logic that determines buffer allocation sizes[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m4[0m[39m. **Related Components:**[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Other IRC command handlers in the same file to check for similar patterns[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Any shared buffer management utilities used by the IRC dissector[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThe investigation should focus on understanding why a [0m[1;36m51[0m[39m-byte buffer was allocated [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mwhen the input requires at least [0m[1;36m132[0m[39m bytes, and whether the size calculation fails [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mto account for multiple channel names, delimiters, or other protocol elements.[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m## Initial Issue Log[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mHere is the initial issue log of the codebase:[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<issue>[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m+ [0m[33mFUZZER[0m[39m=[0m[35mhandler_irc[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m+ shift[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m+ [0m[32m'[0m[32m[[0m[32m'[0m[39m [0m[32m'!'[0m[39m -v TESTCASE [0m[32m'[0m[32m][0m[32m'[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m+ [0m[33mTESTCASE[0m[39m=[0m[35m/[0m[95mtestcase[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m+ [0m[32m'[0m[32m[[0m[32m'[0m[39m [0m[32m'!'[0m[39m -f [0m[35m/[0m[95mtestcase[0m[39m [0m[32m'[0m[32m][0m[32m'[0m                                                          [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m583[0m[39m:     if [0m[1;39m([0m[1;35mtvb_get_uint8[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvb, offset[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m != [0m[32m'#'[0m[1;39m)[0m                                     [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m931[0m[39m:    [0m[39m * XXX - we should eliminate the "length = [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m means 'to the end[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m932[0m[39m:    [0m[39m * of the tvbuff'" convention, and use other means to achieve[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m933[0m[39m:    [0m[39m * that; this would let us eliminate a bunch of checks for[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m934[0m[39m:    [0m[39m * negative lengths in cases where the protocol has a [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m935[0m[39m:    [0m[39m * length field.[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m936[0m[39m:    [0m[39m *[0m                                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m937[0m[39m:    [0m[39m * Allowing [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m but throwing an assertion on other negative[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m938[0m[39m:    [0m[39m * lengths is a bit more work with the length being a size_t;[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m939[0m[39m:    [0m[39m * instead, we check for a length <= [0m[1;36m2[0m[39m^[0m[1;36m31[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m1[0m[39m.[0m                                [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<[0m[35m/[0m[95mcode[0m[39m>[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<code>[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mepan/tvbuff.[0m[1;92mc:3782[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m3978[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3782[0m[39m:uint8_t *[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3783[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mtvb_get_stringz_enc[0m[1;39m([0m[39mwmem_allocator_t *scope, tvbuff_t *tvb, const int offset, [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mint *lengthp, const unsigned encoding[0m[1;39m)[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3784[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m{[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3785[0m[39m:   [0m[39muint8_t *strptr;[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3786[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3787[0m[39m:   [0m[1;35mDISSECTOR_ASSERT[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvb && tvb->initialized[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3788[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3789[0m[39m:   [0m[39mswitch [0m[1;39m([0m[39mencoding & ENC_CHARENCODING_MASK[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3790[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3791[0m[39m:   [0m[39mcase ENC_ASCII:[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3792[0m[39m:   [0m[39mdefault:[0m                                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3793[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[35m/[0m[39m*[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3794[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * For now, we treat bogus values as meaning[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3795[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * [0m[32m"ASCII"[0m[39m rather than reporting an error,[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3796[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * for the benefit of old dissectors written[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3797[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * when the last argument to [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3798[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * was a bool for the byte order, not an[0m                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3799[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * encoding value, and passed non-zero values[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3800[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * other than true to mean [0m[32m"little-endian"[0m[39m.[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3801[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m *[0m[35m/[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3802[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mstrptr = [0m[1;35mtvb_get_ascii_stringz[0m[1;39m([0m[39mscope, tvb, offset, lengthp[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3803[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mbreak;[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3804[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3808[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * to a [0m[32m"substitute"[0m[39m UTF-[0m[1;36m8[0m[39m character.[0m                               [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3285[0m[39m:uint8_t *[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3289[0m[39m:   [0m[39muint8_t *strptr;[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3290[0m[39m:   [0m[39mbool odd, skip_first;[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3291[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3292[0m[39m:   [0m[1;35mDISSECTOR_ASSERT[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvb && tvb->initialized[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                  [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3294[0m[39m:   [0m[35m/[0m[39m* make sure length = [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m fails *[0m[35m/[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3295[0m[39m:   [0m[39mif [0m[1;39m([0m[39mlength < [0m[1;36m0[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3296[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[1;35mTHROW[0m[1;39m([0m[39mReportedBoundsError[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                         [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3300[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3301[0m[39m:   [0m[39mcase ENC_ASCII:[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3302[0m[39m:   [0m[39mdefault:[0m                                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3303[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[35m/[0m[39m*[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3304[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * For now, we treat bogus values as meaning[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3305[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * [0m[32m"ASCII"[0m[39m rather than reporting an error,[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3306[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * for the benefit of old dissectors written[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3307[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * when the last argument to [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3308[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * was a bool for the byte order, not an[0m                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3309[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * encoding value, and passed non-zero values[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3310[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * other than true to mean [0m[32m"little-endian"[0m[39m.[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3311[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m *[0m[35m/[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3312[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mstrptr = [0m[1;35mtvb_get_ascii_string[0m[1;39m([0m[39mscope, tvb, offset, length[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3313[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mbreak;[0m                                                              [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3520[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mstrptr = [0m[1;35mtvb_get_apn_string[0m[1;39m([0m[39mscope, tvb, offset, length[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3521[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mbreak;[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3522[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3523[0m[39m:   [0m[39mcase ENC_DECT_STANDARD_8BITS:[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3524[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mstrptr = [0m[1;35mtvb_get_dect_standard_8bits_string[0m[1;39m([0m[39mscope, tvb, offset, [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mlength[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3525[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mbreak;[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3526[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3527[0m[39m:   [0m[39mcase ENC_DECT_STANDARD_4BITS_TBCD:[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3528[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[35m/[0m[39m*[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3529[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * DECT standard 4bits [0m[32m"telephony BCD"[0m[39m - packed BCD, with[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3530[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m * digits [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m9[0m[39m and symbol SPACE for [0m[1;36m0xb[0m[39m.[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3531[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39m *[0m[35m/[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3532[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39modd = [0m[1;39m([0m[39mencoding & ENC_BCD_ODD_NUM_DIG[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m >> [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m;[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3533[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mskip_first = [0m[1;39m([0m[39mencoding & ENC_BCD_SKIP_FIRST[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m >> [0m[1;36m17[0m[39m;[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3534[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mstrptr = [0m[1;35mtvb_get_bcd_string[0m[1;39m([0m[39mscope, tvb, offset, length, [0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m&Dgt_dect_standard_4bits_tbcd, skip_first, odd, false[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3535[0m[39m:   [0m[39m        [0m[39mbreak;[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3536[0m[39m:   [0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3537[0m[39m:   [0m[39mreturn strptr;[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3538[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<[0m[35m/[0m[95mcode[0m[39m>[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<code>[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mdoc/README.wmem:[0m[1;36m52[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m64[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m52:c[0m[39mhanged without warning.[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m53[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m54:2[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m2[0m[39m Wireshark Global Pools[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m55[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m56:D[0m[39missectors that include the wmem_scopes.h header file will have three pools [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mavailable[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m57[0m[39m:to them automatically: pinfo->pool, [0m[1;35mwmem_file_scope[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m and[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m58[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mwmem_epan_scope[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m; there is also a [0m[1;35mwmem_packet_scope[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m for cases when the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m59[0m[39m:`pinfo` argument is not accessible, but pinfo->pool should be preferred.[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m60[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m61[0m[39m:The pinfo pool is scoped to the dissection of each packet, meaning that any[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m62[0m[39m:memory allocated in it will be automatically freed at the end of the current[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m63[0m[39m:packet. The file pool is similarly scoped to the dissection of each file,[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m64[0m[39m:meaning that any memory allocated in it will be automatically freed when the[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<[0m[35m/[0m[95mcode[0m[39m>[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<code>[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mdoc/README.dissector:[0m[1;36m502[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m3113[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m502[0m[39m:                       const int offset, const int len[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m503[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m504:F[0m[39mormats a bunch of data from a tvbuff as bytes, returning a pointer[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m505[0m[39m:to the string with the data formatted as two hex digits for each byte.[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m506[0m[39m:The string pointed to is stored in an [0m[32m"wmem_alloc'd"[0m[39m buffer which will be freed[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m507:de[0m[39mpending on its scope [0m[1;39m([0m[39mtypically pinfo->pool which is freed after the frame[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m508[0m[39m:The formatted string will contain the hex digits for at most the first [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m bytes[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mof[0m                                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m509[0m[39m:the data. If len is greater than [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m bytes, a trailing [0m[32m"..."[0m[39m will be added to [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mthe string.[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m510[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m511:c[0m[39mhar *[0m[1;35mtvb_bytes_to_str_punct[0m[1;39m([0m[39mwmem_allocator_t *scope, tvbuff_t *tvb,[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m512[0m[39m:                             const int offset, const int len, const char [0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mpunct[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m513[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m514[0m[39m:This function is similar to [0m[1;35mtvb_bytes_to_str[0m[1;39m([0m[33m...[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m except that [0m[32m'punct'[0m[39m is [0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39minserted[0m                                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m515:be[0m[39mtween the hex representation of each byte.[0m                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m516[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m517[0m[39m:GByteArray *[0m[1;35mtvb_get_string_bytes[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvbuff_t *tvb, const int offset, const int [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mlength,[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m518[0m[39m:                                 const unsigned encoding, GByteArray* bytes, [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mint *endoff[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m519[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m520[0m[39m:Given a tvbuff, an offset into the tvbuff, and a length that starts[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m521:a[0m[39mt that offset [0m[1;39m([0m[39mwhich may be [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m for "all the way to the end of the[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m522[0m[39m:tvbuff"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, fetch the hex-decoded byte values of the tvbuff into the[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m523[0m[39m:passed-in [0m[32m'bytes'[0m[39m array, based on the passed-in encoding. In other[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m524[0m[39m:words, convert from a hex-ascii string in tvbuff, into the supplied[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m525[0m[39m:GByteArray.[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m526[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m527:c[0m[39mhar *[0m[1;35mtvb_bcd_dig_to_wmem_packet_str[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvbuff_t *tvb, const int offset,[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m528[0m[39m:                                     const int len, dgt_set_t *dgt, bool [0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mskip_first[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m529[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m530[0m[39m:Given a tvbuff, an offset into the tvbuff, and a length that starts[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m531:a[0m[39mt that offset [0m[1;39m([0m[39mwhich may be [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m for "all the way to the end of the[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m532[0m[39m:tvbuff"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, fetch BCD encoded digits from a tvbuff starting from either[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m533[0m[39m:the low or high half byte, formatting the digits according to an input digit [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mset,[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m534[0m[39m:if NUll a default digit set of [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m9[0m[39m returning [0m[32m"?"[0m[39m for overdecadic digits will be[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mused.[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m535:A[0m[39m pointer to the packet scope allocated string will be returned.[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m536[0m[39m:Note: a tvbuff content of [0m[1;36m0xf[0m[39m is considered a [0m[32m'filler'[0m[39m and will end the [0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mconversion.[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m537[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m538:C[0m[39mopying memory:[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m539[0m[39m:void *[0m[1;35mtvb_memcpy[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvbuff_t *tvb, void *target, const int offset, size_t length[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m540[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m541:C[0m[39mopies into the specified target the specified length's worth of data[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m542:f[0m[39mrom the specified tvbuff, starting at the specified offset.[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m543[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m544[0m[39m:void *[0m[1;35mtvb_memdup[0m[1;39m([0m[39mwmem_allocator_t *scope, tvbuff_t *tvb, const int offset, [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39msize_t length[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m545[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m546[0m[39m:Returns a buffer containing a copy of the given TVB bytes. The buffer is[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m547:a[0m[39mllocated in the given wmem scope [0m[1;39m([0m[39msee README.wmem for more information[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m548[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m549[0m[39m:Pointer-retrieval:[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m550[0m[39m:[0m[35m/[0m[39m* WARNING! Don't use this function. There is almost always a better way.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m551[0m[39m: * It's dangerous because once this pointer is given to the user, there's[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m552[0m[39m: * no guarantee that the user will honor the [0m[32m'length'[0m[39m and not overstep the[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m553[0m[39m: * boundaries of the buffer. Also see the warning in the Portability section.[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m554[0m[39m: *[0m[35m/[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m555:c[0m[39monst uint8_t *[0m[1;35mtvb_get_ptr[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvbuff_t *tvb, const int offset, const int length[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m556[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m557[0m[39m:Length query:[0m                                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m558[0m[39m:Get amount of captured data in the buffer [0m[1;39m([0m[39mwhich is *NOT* necessarily the[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m559[0m[39m:length of the packet[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. You probably want tvb_reported_length instead:[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m560[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m561[0m[39m:    unsigned [0m[1;35mtvb_captured_length[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst tvbuff_t *tvb[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m562[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m563[0m[39m:Get reported length of buffer:[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m564[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m565[0m[39m:    unsigned [0m[1;35mtvb_reported_length[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst tvbuff_t *tvb[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m566[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m567[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m568:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m4[0m[39m Functions to handle columns in the traffic summary window.[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m569[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m570[0m[39m:The topmost pane of the main window is a list of the packets in the[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m571:ca[0m[39mpture, possibly filtered by a display filter.[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m572[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m573:Eac[0m[39mh line corresponds to a packet, and has one or more columns, as[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m574:c[0m[39monfigured by the user.[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m575[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m576[0m[39m:Many of the columns are handled by code outside individual dissectors;[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m577[0m[39m:most dissectors need only specify the value to put in the [0m[32m"Protocol"[0m[39m and[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m578[0m[39m:[0m[32m"Info"[0m[39m columns.[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m579[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m580:C[0m[39molumns are specified by COL_ values; the COL_ value for the [0m[32m"Protocol"[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m581:f[0m[39mield, typically giving an abbreviated name for the protocol [0m[1;39m([0m[39mbut not[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m582[0m[39m:the all-lower-case abbreviation used elsewhere[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m is COL_PROTOCOL, and the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m583:C[0m[39mOL_ value for the [0m[32m"Info"[0m[39m field, giving a summary of the contents of the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m584[0m[39m:packet for that protocol, is COL_INFO.[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m585[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m586[0m[39m:The value for a column can be specified with one of several functions,[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m587:a[0m[39mll of which take the [0m[32m'fd'[0m[39m argument to the dissector as their first[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m588:a[0m[39mrgument, and the COL_ value for the column as their second argument.[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m589[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m590:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m4.1[0m[39m The col_set_str function.[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m591[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m592[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_set_str'[0m[39m takes a string as its third argument, and sets the value[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m593:f[0m[39mor the column to that value. It assumes that the pointer passed to it[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m594[0m[39m:points to a string constant or a static [0m[32m"const"[0m[39m array, not to a[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m595[0m[39m:variable, as it doesn't copy the string, it merely saves the pointer[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m596[0m[39m:value; the argument can itself be a variable, as long as it always[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m597[0m[39m:points to a string constant or a static [0m[32m"const"[0m[39m array.[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m598[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m599[0m[39m:It is more efficient than [0m[32m'col_add_str'[0m[39m or [0m[32m'col_add_fstr'[0m[39m; however, if[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m600[0m[39m:the dissector will be using [0m[32m'col_append_str'[0m[39m or 'col_append_fstr" to[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m601:a[0m[39mppend more information to the column, the string will have to be copied[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m602:a[0m[39mnyway, so it's best to use [0m[32m'col_add_str'[0m[39m rather than [0m[32m'col_set_str'[0m[39m in[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m603[0m[39m:that case.[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m604[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m605:F[0m[39mor example, to set the [0m[32m"Protocol"[0m[39m column[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m606[0m[39m:to [0m[32m"PROTOFILTERNAME"[0m[39m:[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m607[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m608[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mcol_set_str[0m[1;39m([0m[39mpinfo->cinfo, COL_PROTOCOL, [0m[32m"PROTOFILTERNAME"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m609[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m610[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m611:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m4.2[0m[39m The col_add_str function.[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m612[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m613[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_add_str'[0m[39m takes a string as its third argument, and sets the value[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m614:f[0m[39mor the column to that value. It takes the same arguments as[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m615[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_set_str'[0m[39m, but copies the string, so that if the string is, for[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m616:e[0m[39mxample, an automatic variable that won't remain in scope when the[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m617:d[0m[39missector returns, it's safe to use.[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m618[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m619[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m620:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m4.3[0m[39m The col_add_fstr function.[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m621[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m622[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_add_fstr'[0m[39m takes a [0m[32m'printf'[0m[39m-style format string as its third[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m623:a[0m[39mrgument, and [0m[32m'printf'[0m[39m-style arguments corresponding to [0m[32m'%'[0m[39m format[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m624[0m[39m:items in that string as its subsequent arguments. For example, to set[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m625[0m[39m:the [0m[32m"Info"[0m[39m field to [0m[32m"<XXX> request, <N> bytes"[0m[39m, where [0m[32m"reqtype"[0m[39m is a[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m626[0m[39m:string containing the type of the request in the packet and [0m[32m"n"[0m[39m is an[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m627[0m[39m:unsigned integer containing the number of bytes in the request:[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m628[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m629[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mcol_add_fstr[0m[1;39m([0m[39mpinfo->cinfo, COL_INFO, [0m[32m"%s request, %u bytes"[0m[39m,[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m630[0m[39m:                 reqtype, n[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m631[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m632:D[0m[39mon't use [0m[32m'col_add_fstr'[0m[39m with a format argument of just [0m[32m"%s"[0m[39m -[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m633[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_add_str'[0m[39m, or possibly even [0m[32m'col_set_str'[0m[39m if the string that matches[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m634[0m[39m:the [0m[32m"%s"[0m[39m is a static constant string, will do the same job more[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m635:eff[0m[39miciently.[0m                                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m636[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m637[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m638:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m4.4[0m[39m The col_clear function.[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m639[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m640[0m[39m:If the Info column will be filled with information from the packet, that[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m641[0m[39m:means that some data will be fetched from the packet before the Info[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m642:c[0m[39molumn is filled in. If the packet is so small that the data in[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m643[0m[39m:question cannot be fetched, the routines to fetch the data will throw an[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m644:e[0m[39mxception [0m[1;39m([0m[39msee the comment at the beginning about tvbuffers improving[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m645[0m[39m:the handling of short packets - the tvbuffers keep track of how much[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m646:da[0m[39mta is in the packet, and throw an exception on an attempt to fetch[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m647:da[0m[39mta past the end of the packet, so that the dissector won't process[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m648:b[0m[39mogus data[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, causing the Info column not to be filled in.[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m649[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m650[0m[39m:This means that the Info column will have data for the previous[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m651[0m[39m:protocol, which would be confusing if, for example, the Protocol column[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m652[0m[39m:had data for this protocol.[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m653[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m654[0m[39m:Therefore, before a dissector fetches any data whatsoever from the[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m655[0m[39m:packet [0m[1;39m([0m[39munless it's a heuristic dissector fetching data to determine[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m656[0m[39m:whether the packet is one that it should dissect, in which case it[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m657[0m[39m:should check, before fetching the data, whether there's any data to[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m658:fe[0m[39mtch; if there isn't, it should return false[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, it should set the[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m659[0m[39m:Protocol column and the Info column.[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m660[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m661[0m[39m:If the Protocol column will ultimately be set to, for example, a value[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m662:c[0m[39montaining a protocol version number, with the version number being a[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m663:f[0m[39mield in the packet, the dissector should, before fetching the version[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m664[0m[39m:number field or any other field from the packet, set it to a value[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m665[0m[39m:without a version number, using [0m[32m'col_set_str'[0m[39m, and should later set it[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m666[0m[39m:to a value with the version number after it's fetched the version[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m667[0m[39m:number.[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m668[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m669[0m[39m:If the Info column will ultimately be set to a value containing[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m670[0m[39m:information from the packet, the dissector should, before fetching any[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m671:f[0m[39mields from the packet, clear the column using [0m[32m'col_clear'[0m[39m [0m[1;39m([0m[39mwhich is[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m672[0m[39m:more efficient than clearing it by calling [0m[32m'col_set_str'[0m[39m or[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m673[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_add_str'[0m[39m with a null string[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, and should later set it to the real[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m674[0m[39m:string after it's fetched the data to use when doing that.[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m675[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m676[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m677:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m4.5[0m[39m The col_append_str function.[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m678[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m679[0m[39m:Sometimes the value of a column, especially the [0m[32m"Info"[0m[39m column, can't be[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m680:c[0m[39monveniently constructed at a single point in the dissection process;[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m681:f[0m[39mor example, it might contain small bits of information from many of the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m682:f[0m[39mields in the packet. [0m[32m'col_append_str'[0m[39m takes, as arguments, the same[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m683:a[0m[39mrguments as [0m[32m'col_add_str'[0m[39m, but the string is appended to the end of the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m684:c[0m[39murrent value for the column, rather than replacing the value for that[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m685:c[0m[39molumn. [0m[1;39m([0m[39mNote that no blank separates the appended string from the[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m686[0m[39m:string to which it is appended; if you want a blank there, you must add[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m687[0m[39m:it yourself as part of the string being appended.[0m[1;39m)[0m                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m688[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m689[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m690:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m4.6[0m[39m The col_append_fstr function.[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m691[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m692[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_append_fstr'[0m[39m is to [0m[32m'col_add_fstr'[0m[39m as [0m[32m'col_append_str'[0m[39m is to[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m693[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_add_str'[0m[39m - it takes, as arguments, the same arguments as[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m694[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_add_fstr'[0m[39m, but the formatted string is appended to the end of the[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m695:c[0m[39murrent value for the column, rather than replacing the value for that[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m696:c[0m[39molumn.[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m697[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m698:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m4.7[0m[39m The col_append_sep_str and col_append_sep_fstr functions.[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m699[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m700[0m[39m:In specific situations the developer knows that a column's value will be[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m701:c[0m[39mreated in a stepwise manner, where the appended values are listed. Both[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m702[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_append_sep_str'[0m[39m and [0m[32m'col_append_sep_fstr'[0m[39m functions will add an item[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m703[0m[39m:separator between two consecutive items, and will not add the separator at the[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m704:be[0m[39mginning of the column. The remainder of the work both functions do is[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m705[0m[39m:identical to what [0m[32m'col_append_str'[0m[39m and [0m[32m'col_append_fstr'[0m[39m do.[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m706[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m707:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m4.8[0m[39m The col_set_fence and col_prepend_fence_fstr functions.[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m708[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m709[0m[39m:Sometimes a dissector may be called multiple times for different PDUs in the[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m710[0m[39m:same frame [0m[1;39m([0m[39mfor example in the case of SCTP chunk bundling: several upper[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m711[0m[39m:layer data packets may be contained in one SCTP packet[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. If the upper layer[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m712:d[0m[39missector calls [0m[32m'col_set_str[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m or [0m[32m'col_clear[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m on the Info column when it[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m713:be[0m[39mgins dissecting each of those PDUs then when the frame is fully dissected[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m714[0m[39m:the Info column would contain only the string from the last PDU in the frame.[0m   [2m                [0m
