[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m715[0m[39m:The [0m[32m'col_set_fence'[0m[39m function erects a [0m[32m"fence"[0m[39m in the column that prevents[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m716[0m[39m:subsequent [0m[32m'col_...'[0m[39m calls from clearing the data currently in that column.[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m717:F[0m[39mor example, the SCTP dissector calls [0m[32m'col_set_fence'[0m[39m on the Info column[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m718:af[0m[39mter it has called any subdissectors for that chunk so that subdissectors[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m719[0m[39m:of any subsequent chunks may only append to the Info column.[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m720[0m[39m:[0m[32m'col_prepend_fence_fstr'[0m[39m prepends data before a fence [0m[1;39m([0m[39mmoving it if[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m721[0m[39m:necessary[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. It will create a fence at the end of the prepended data if the[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m722:fe[0m[39mnce does not already exist.[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m723[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m724[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m725:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m4.9[0m[39m The col_set_time function.[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m726[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m727[0m[39m:The [0m[32m'col_set_time'[0m[39m function takes an nstime value as its third argument.[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m728[0m[39m:This nstime value is a relative value and will be added as such to the[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m729:c[0m[39molumn. The fourth argument is the filtername holding this value. This[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m730[0m[39m:way, rightclicking on the column makes it possible to build a filter[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m731:ba[0m[39msed on the time-value.[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m732[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m733:F[0m[39mor example:[0m                                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m734[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m735[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mcol_set_time[0m[1;39m([0m[39mpinfo->cinfo, COL_REL_TIME, &ts, [0m[32m"s4607.ploc.time"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m736[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m737[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m738:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m5[0m[39m Constructing the protocol tree.[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m739[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m740[0m[39m:The middle pane of the main window, and the topmost pane of a packet[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m741[0m[39m:popup window, are constructed from the [0m[32m"protocol tree"[0m[39m for a packet.[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m742[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m743[0m[39m:The protocol tree, or proto_tree, is an N-way tree structure of proto_nodes.[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m744[0m[39m:Of course the protocol dissectors don't care what a proto_tree really is;[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m745[0m[39m:they just pass the proto_tree pointer as an argument to the routines which[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m746:a[0m[39mllow them to add items and new branches to the tree. [0m[1;39m([0m[39mSome protocol dissectors[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m747:d[0m[39mo access struct members directly instead of calling routines; this is[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m748:de[0m[39mprecated.[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m749[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m750[0m[39m:When a packet is selected in the packet-list pane, or a packet popup[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m751[0m[39m:window is created, a new logical protocol tree [0m[1;39m([0m[39mproto_tree[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m is created.[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m752[0m[39m:The pointer to the proto_tree [0m[1;39m([0m[39min this case, [0m[32m'protocol tree'[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, is passed[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m753[0m[39m:to the top-level protocol dissector, and then to all subsequent protocol[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m754:d[0m[39missectors for that packet, and then the GUI tree is drawn via[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m755[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_draw[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m756[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m757[0m[39m:The logical proto_tree needs to know detailed information about the protocols[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m758:a[0m[39mnd fields about which information will be collected from the dissection[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m759[0m[39m:routines. By strictly defining [0m[1;39m([0m[39mor [0m[32m"typing"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m the data that can be attached to a[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m760[0m[39m:proto tree, searching and filtering becomes possible. This means that for[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m761:e[0m[39mvery protocol and field [0m[1;39m([0m[39mwhich I also call [0m[32m"header fields"[0m[39m, since they are[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m762:f[0m[39mields in the protocol headers[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m which might be attached to a tree, some[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m763[0m[39m:information is needed.[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m764[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m765:E[0m[39mvery dissector routine will need to register its protocols and fields[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m766[0m[39m:with the central protocol routines [0m[1;39m([0m[39min proto.c[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. At first I thought I[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m767[0m[39m:might keep all the protocol and field information about all the[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m768:d[0m[39missectors in one file, but decentralization seemed like a better idea.[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m769[0m[39m:That one file would have gotten very large; one small change would have[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m770[0m[39m:required a re-compilation of the entire file. Also, by allowing[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m771[0m[39m:registration of protocols and fields at run-time, loadable modules of[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m772[0m[39m:protocol dissectors [0m[1;39m([0m[39mperhaps even user-supplied[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m is feasible.[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m773[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m774[0m[39m:To do this, each protocol should have a register routine, which will be[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m775:ca[0m[39mlled when Wireshark starts. The code to call the register routines is[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m776[0m[39m:generated automatically; to arrange that a protocol's register routine[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m777:be[0m[39m called at startup:[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m778[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m779[0m[39m:    the file containing a dissector's [0m[32m"register"[0m[39m routine must be[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m780[0m[39m:    added to [0m[32m"DISSECTOR_SRC"[0m[39m in [0m[32m"epan/dissectors/CMakeLists.txt"[0m[39m;[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m781[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m782[0m[39m:    the [0m[32m"register"[0m[39m routine must have a name of the form[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m783[0m[39m:    [0m[32m"proto_register_XXX"[0m[39m;[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m784[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m785[0m[39m:    the [0m[32m"register"[0m[39m routine must take no argument, and return no[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m786[0m[39m:    value;[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m787[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m788[0m[39m:    the [0m[32m"register"[0m[39m routine's name must appear in the source file[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m789[0m[39m:    either at the beginning of the line, or preceded only by [0m[32m"void "[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m790[0m[39m:    at the beginning of the line [0m[1;39m([0m[39mthat would typically be the[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m791[0m[39m:    definition[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m - other white space shouldn't cause a problem, e.g.:[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m792[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m793[0m[39m:void [0m[1;35mproto_register_XXX[0m[1;39m([0m[39mvoid[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m794[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m795[0m[39m:    [0m[33m...[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m796[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m797[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m798[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m799:a[0m[39mnd[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m800[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m801[0m[39m:void[0m                                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m802[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_register_XXX[0m[1;39m([0m[39m void [0m[1;39m)[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m803[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m{[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m804[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m805[0m[39m:    [0m[33m...[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m806[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m807[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m808[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m809[0m[39m:    and so on should work.[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m810[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m811:F[0m[39mor every protocol or field that a dissector wants to register, a variable of[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m812[0m[39m:type int needs to be used to keep track of the protocol. The IDs are[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m813[0m[39m:needed for establishing parent/child relationships between protocols and[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m814:f[0m[39mields, as well as associating data with a particular field so that it[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m815:ca[0m[39mn be stored in the logical tree and displayed in the GUI protocol[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m816[0m[39m:tree.[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m817[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m818[0m[39m:Some dissectors will need to create branches within their tree to help[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m819[0m[39m:organize header fields. These branches should be registered as header[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m820:f[0m[39mields. Only true protocols should be registered as protocols. This is[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m821[0m[39m:so that a display filter user interface knows how to distinguish[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m822[0m[39m:protocols from fields.[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m823[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m824:A[0m[39m protocol is registered with the name of the protocol and its[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m825:abb[0m[39mreviation.[0m                                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m826[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m827[0m[39m:Here is how the frame [0m[32m"protocol"[0m[39m is registered.[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m828[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m829[0m[39m:        int proto_frame;[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m830[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m831[0m[39m:        proto_frame = proto_register_protocol [0m[1;39m([0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m832[0m[39m:                [0m[35m/[0m[39m* name *[0m[35m/[0m[39m            [0m[32m"Frame"[0m[39m,[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m833[0m[39m:                [0m[35m/[0m[39m* short name *[0m[35m/[0m[39m      [0m[32m"Frame"[0m[39m,[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m834[0m[39m:                [0m[35m/[0m[39m* abbrev *[0m[35m/[0m[39m          [0m[32m"frame"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m835[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m836:A[0m[39m header field is also registered with its name and abbreviation, but[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m837[0m[39m:information about its data type is needed. It helps to look at[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m838[0m[39m:the header_field_info struct to see what information is expected:[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m839[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m840[0m[39m:struct header_field_info [0m[1;39m{[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m841[0m[39m:    const char        *name;[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m842[0m[39m:    const char        *abbrev;[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m843[0m[39m:    enum ftenum        type;[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m844[0m[39m:    int                display;[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m845[0m[39m:    const void        *strings;[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m846[0m[39m:    uint64_t           bitmask;[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m847[0m[39m:    const char        *blurb;[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m848[0m[39m:    [0m[33m...[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m849[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m}[0m[39m;[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m850[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m851[0m[39m:name [0m[1;39m([0m[39mFIELDNAME[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m852[0m[39m:----------------[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m853:A[0m[39m string representing the name of the field. This is the name[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m854[0m[39m:that will appear in the graphical protocol tree. It must be a non-empty[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m855[0m[39m:string.[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m856[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m857:abb[0m[39mrev [0m[1;39m([0m[39mFIELDFILTERNAME[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m858[0m[39m:--------------------[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m859:A[0m[39m string with a filter name for the field. The name should start[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m860[0m[39m:with the filter name of the parent protocol followed by a period as a[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m861[0m[39m:separator. For example, the [0m[32m"src"[0m[39m field in an IP packet would have [0m[32m"ip.src"[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m862:a[0m[39ms a filter name. It is acceptable to have multiple levels of periods if,[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m863:f[0m[39mor example, you have fields in your protocol that are then subdivided into[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m864[0m[39m:subfields. For example, TRMAC has multiple error fields, so the names[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m865:f[0m[39mollow this pattern: [0m[32m"trmac.errors.iso"[0m[39m, [0m[32m"trmac.errors.noniso"[0m[39m, etc.[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m866[0m[39m:It must be a non-empty string.[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m867[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m868[0m[39m:type [0m[1;39m([0m[39mFIELDTYPE[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m869[0m[39m:----------------[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m870[0m[39m:The type of value this field holds. The current field types are:[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m871[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m872[0m[39m:    FT_NONE     No field type. Used for fields that[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m873[0m[39m:                aren't given a value, and that can only[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m874[0m[39m:                be tested for presence or absence; a[0m                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m875[0m[39m:                field that represents a data structure,[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m876[0m[39m:                with a subtree below it containing[0m                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m877[0m[39m:                fields for the members of the structure,[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m878[0m[39m:                or that represents an array with a[0m                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m879[0m[39m:                subtree below it containing fields for[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m880[0m[39m:                the members of the array, might be an[0m                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m881[0m[39m:                FT_NONE field.[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m882[0m[39m:    FT_PROTOCOL Used for protocols which will be placing[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m883[0m[39m:                themselves as top-level items in the[0m                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m884[0m[39m:                [0m[32m"Packet Details"[0m[39m pane of the UI.[0m                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m885[0m[39m:    FT_BOOLEAN  [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m means [0m[32m"false"[0m[39m, any other value means[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m886[0m[39m:                [0m[32m"true"[0m[39m.[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m887[0m[39m:    FT_FRAMENUM A frame number; if this is used, the "Go[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m888[0m[39m:                To Corresponding Frame" menu item can[0m                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m889[0m[39m:                work on that field.[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m890[0m[39m:    FT_CHAR     An [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m-bit ASCII character. It's treated similarly to an[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m891[0m[39m:                FT_UINT8, but is displayed as a C-style character[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m892[0m[39m:                constant.[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m893[0m[39m:    FT_UINT8    An [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m-bit unsigned integer.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m894[0m[39m:    FT_UINT16   A [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m-bit unsigned integer.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m895[0m[39m:    FT_UINT24   A [0m[1;36m24[0m[39m-bit unsigned integer.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m896[0m[39m:    FT_UINT32   A [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit unsigned integer.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m897[0m[39m:    FT_UINT40   A [0m[1;36m40[0m[39m-bit unsigned integer.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m898[0m[39m:    FT_UINT48   A [0m[1;36m48[0m[39m-bit unsigned integer.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m899[0m[39m:    FT_UINT56   A [0m[1;36m56[0m[39m-bit unsigned integer.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m900[0m[39m:    FT_UINT64   A [0m[1;36m64[0m[39m-bit unsigned integer.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m901[0m[39m:    FT_INT8     An [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m-bit signed integer.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m902[0m[39m:    FT_INT16    A [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m-bit signed integer.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m903[0m[39m:    FT_INT24    A [0m[1;36m24[0m[39m-bit signed integer.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m904[0m[39m:    FT_INT32    A [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit signed integer.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m905[0m[39m:    FT_INT40    A [0m[1;36m40[0m[39m-bit signed integer.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m906[0m[39m:    FT_INT48    A [0m[1;36m48[0m[39m-bit signed integer.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m907[0m[39m:    FT_INT56    A [0m[1;36m56[0m[39m-bit signed integer.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m908[0m[39m:    FT_INT64    A [0m[1;36m64[0m[39m-bit signed integer.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m909[0m[39m:    FT_IEEE_11073_SFLOAT    A [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m-bit floating point number, consisting[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m910[0m[39m:                of an [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m-bit exponent and [0m[1;36m12[0m[39m-bit mantissa.[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m911[0m[39m:    FT_IEEE_11073_FLOAT     A [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit floating point number, consisting[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m912[0m[39m:                of an [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m-bit exponent and [0m[1;36m24[0m[39m-bit mantissa.[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m913[0m[39m:    FT_FLOAT    A single-precision floating point number.[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m914[0m[39m:    FT_DOUBLE   A double-precision floating point number.[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m915[0m[39m:    FT_ABSOLUTE_TIME    An absolute time from some fixed point in time,[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m916[0m[39m:                displayed as the date, followed by the time, as[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m917[0m[39m:                hours, minutes, and seconds with [0m[1;36m9[0m[39m digits after[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m918[0m[39m:                the decimal point.[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m919[0m[39m:    FT_RELATIVE_TIME    Seconds [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m and nanoseconds [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes[0m[1;39m)[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m920[0m[39m:                of time relative to an arbitrary time.[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m921[0m[39m:                displayed as seconds and [0m[1;36m9[0m[39m digits[0m                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m922[0m[39m:                after the decimal point.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m923[0m[39m:    FT_STRING   A string of characters, not necessarily[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m924[0m[39m:                NULL-terminated, but possibly NULL-padded.[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m925[0m[39m:                This, and the other string-of-characters[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m926[0m[39m:                types, are to be used for text strings,[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m927[0m[39m:                not raw binary data.[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m928[0m[39m:    FT_STRINGZ  A NULL-terminated string of characters.[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m929[0m[39m:                The string length is normally the length[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m930[0m[39m:                given in the [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m call.[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m931[0m[39m:                However if the length given in the call[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m932[0m[39m:                is [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m, then the length used is that[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m933[0m[39m:                returned by calling [0m[1;35mtvb_strsize[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m934[0m[39m:                This should only be used if the string,[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m935[0m[39m:                in the packet, is always terminated with[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m936[0m[39m:                a NULL character, either because the length[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m937[0m[39m:                isn't otherwise specified or because a[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m938[0m[39m:                character count *and* a NULL terminator are[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m939[0m[39m:                both used.[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m940[0m[39m:    FT_STRINGZPAD   A NULL-padded string of characters.[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m941[0m[39m:                The length is given in the [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m942[0m[39m:                call, but may be larger than the length of[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m943[0m[39m:                the string, with extra bytes being NULL padding.[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m944[0m[39m:                This is typically used for fixed-length fields[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m945[0m[39m:                that contain a string value that might be shorter[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m946[0m[39m:                than the fixed length.[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m947[0m[39m:    FT_STRINGZTRUNC  A NULL-truncated string of characters.[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m948[0m[39m:                The length is given in the [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m949[0m[39m:                call, but may be larger than the length of[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m950[0m[39m:                the string, with a NULL character after the last[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m951[0m[39m:                character of the string, and the remaining bytes[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m952[0m[39m:                being padding with unspecified contents.  This is[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m953[0m[39m:                typically used for fixed-length fields that contain[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m954[0m[39m:                a string value that might be shorter than the fixed[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m955[0m[39m:                length.[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m956[0m[39m:    FT_UINT_STRING  A counted string of characters, consisting[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m957[0m[39m:                of a count [0m[1;39m([0m[39mrepresented as an integral value,[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m958[0m[39m:                of width given in the [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m959[0m[39m:                call[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m followed immediately by that number of[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m960[0m[39m:                characters.[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m961[0m[39m:    FT_ETHER    A six octet string displayed in[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m962[0m[39m:                Ethernet-address format.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m963[0m[39m:    FT_BYTES    A string of bytes with arbitrary values;[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m964[0m[39m:                used for raw binary data.[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m965[0m[39m:    FT_UINT_BYTES   A counted string of bytes, consisting[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m966[0m[39m:                of a count [0m[1;39m([0m[39mrepresented as an integral value,[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m967[0m[39m:                of width given in the [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m968[0m[39m:                call[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m followed immediately by that number of[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m969[0m[39m:                arbitrary values; used for raw binary data.[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m970[0m[39m:    FT_IPv4     A version [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m IP address [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m displayed[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m971[0m[39m:                in dotted-quad IP address format [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m4[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m972[0m[39m:                decimal numbers separated by dots[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m973[0m[39m:    FT_IPv6     A version [0m[1;36m6[0m[39m IP address [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m16[0m[39m bytes[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m displayed[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m974[0m[39m:                in standard IPv6 address format.[0m                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m975[0m[39m:    FT_IPXNET   An IPX address displayed in hex as a [0m[1;36m6[0m[39m-byte[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m976[0m[39m:                network number followed by a [0m[1;36m6[0m[39m-byte station[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m977[0m[39m:                address.[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m978[0m[39m:    FT_GUID     A Globally Unique Identifier[0m                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m979[0m[39m:    FT_OID      An ASN.[0m[1;36m1[0m[39m Object Identifier[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m980[0m[39m:    FT_REL_OID  An ASN.[0m[1;36m1[0m[39m Relative Object Identifier[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m981[0m[39m:    FT_EUI64    A EUI-[0m[1;36m64[0m[39m Address[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m982[0m[39m:    FT_AX25     A AX-[0m[1;36m25[0m[39m Address[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m983[0m[39m:    FT_VINES    A Vines Address[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m984[0m[39m:    FT_SYSTEM_ID  An OSI System-ID[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m985[0m[39m:    FT_FCWWN    A Fibre Channel WWN Address[0m                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m986[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m987[0m[39m:Some of these field types are still not handled in the display filter[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m988[0m[39m:routines, but the most common ones are. The FT_UINT* variables all[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m989[0m[39m:represent unsigned integers, and the FT_INT* variables all represent[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m990[0m[39m:signed integers; the number on the end represent how many bits are used[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m991[0m[39m:to represent the number.[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m992[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m993[0m[39m:Some constraints are imposed on the header fields depending on the type[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m994[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m([0m[39me.g. FT_BYTES[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m of the field. Fields of type FT_ABSOLUTE_TIME must use[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m995[0m[39m:[0m[32m'ABSOLUTE_TIME_[0m[32m{[0m[32mLOCAL,UTC,DOY_UTC[0m[32m}[0m[32m, NULL, 0x0'[0m[39m as values for the[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m996[0m[39m:[0m[32m'display, '[0m[39mstrings', and [0m[32m'bitmask'[0m[39m fields, and all other non-integral[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m997[0m[39m:types [0m[1;39m([0m[39mi.e.. types that are _not_ FT_INT* and FT_UINT*[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m must use[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m998[0m[39m:[0m[32m'BASE_NONE, NULL, 0x0'[0m[39m as values for the [0m[32m'display'[0m[39m, [0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m, [0m[32m'bitmask'[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m999:f[0m[39mields. The reason is simply that the type itself implicitly defines the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1000[0m[39m:nature of [0m[32m'display'[0m[39m, [0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m, [0m[32m'bitmask'[0m[39m.[0m                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1001[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1002:d[0m[39misplay [0m[1;39m([0m[39mFIELDDISPLAY[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1003[0m[39m:----------------------[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1004[0m[39m:The display field has a couple of overloaded uses. This is unfortunate,[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1005:b[0m[39mut since we're using C as an application programming language, this sometimes[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1006[0m[39m:makes for cleaner programs. Right now I still think that overloading[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1007[0m[39m:this variable was okay.[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1008[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1009:F[0m[39mor integer fields [0m[1;39m([0m[39mFT_UINT* and FT_INT*[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, this variable represents the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1010:ba[0m[39mse in which you would like the value displayed. The acceptable bases[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1011:a[0m[39mre:[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1012[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1013[0m[39m:    BASE_DEC,[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1014[0m[39m:    BASE_HEX,[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1015[0m[39m:    BASE_OCT,[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1016[0m[39m:    BASE_DEC_HEX,[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1017[0m[39m:    BASE_HEX_DEC,[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1018[0m[39m:    BASE_CUSTOM[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1019[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1020:BA[0m[39mSE_DEC, BASE_HEX, and BASE_OCT are decimal, hexadecimal, and octal,[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1021[0m[39m:respectively. BASE_DEC_HEX and BASE_HEX_DEC display value in two bases[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1022[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m([0m[39mthe 1st representation followed by the 2nd in parenthesis[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1023[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1024:BA[0m[39mSE_CUSTOM allows one to specify a callback function pointer that will[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1025:f[0m[39mormat the value.[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1026[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1027:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit and smaller values, custom_fmt_func_t can be used to declare[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1028[0m[39m:the callback function pointer. Specifically, this is defined as:[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1029[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1030[0m[39m:    void [0m[1;35mfunc[0m[1;39m([0m[39mchar *, uint32_t[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1031[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1032:F[0m[39mor values larger than [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bits, custom_fmt_func_64_t can be used to declare[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1033[0m[39m:the callback function pointer. Specifically, this is defined as:[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1034[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1035[0m[39m:    void [0m[1;35mfunc[0m[1;39m([0m[39mchar *, uint64_t[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1036[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1037:F[0m[39mor floating point values, custom_fmt_func_double_t can be used to declare[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1038[0m[39m:the callback function pointer. Specifically, this is defined as:[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1039[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1040[0m[39m:    void [0m[1;35mfunc[0m[1;39m([0m[39mchar *, double[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1041[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1042[0m[39m:The first argument is a pointer to a buffer of the ITEM_LABEL_LENGTH size[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1043:a[0m[39mnd the second argument is the value to be formatted.[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1044[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1045[0m[39m:The callback function pointer types are defined in epan/proto.h.[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1046[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1047:F[0m[39mor FT_UINT16 [0m[32m'display'[0m[39m can be used to select a transport layer protocol using[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mone[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1048[0m[39m:of BASE_PT_UDP, BASE_PT_TCP, BASE_PT_DCCP or BASE_PT_SCTP. If transport name[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1049[0m[39m:resolution is enabled the port field label is displayed in decimal and as a [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mwell-known[0m                                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1050[0m[39m:service name [0m[1;39m([0m[39mif one is available[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1051[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1052:F[0m[39mor FT_BOOLEAN fields that are also bitfields [0m[1;39m([0m[39mi.e., [0m[32m'bitmask'[0m[39m is non-zero[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m,[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1053[0m[39m:[0m[32m'display'[0m[39m is used specify a [0m[32m"field-width"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m([0m[39mi.e., tell the proto_tree how[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1054[0m[39m:wide the parent bitfield is[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. [0m[1;39m([0m[39mIf the FT_BOOLEAN [0m[32m'bitmask'[0m[39m is zero, then[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1055[0m[39m:[0m[32m'display'[0m[39m must be BASE_NONE[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1056[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1057:F[0m[39mor integer fields a [0m[32m"field-width"[0m[39m is not needed since the type of[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1058[0m[39m:integer itself [0m[1;39m([0m[39mFT_UINT8, FT_UINT16, FT_UINT24, FT_UINT32, FT_UINT40,[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1059:F[0m[39mT_UINT48, FT_UINT56, FT_UINT64, etc[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m tells the proto_tree how wide the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1060[0m[39m:parent bitfield is. The same is true of FT_CHAR, as it's an [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m-bit[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1061:c[0m[39mharacter.[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1062[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1063:F[0m[39mor FT_ABSOLUTE_TIME fields, [0m[32m'display'[0m[39m is used to indicate whether the[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1064[0m[39m:time is to be displayed as a time in the time zone for the machine on[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1065[0m[39m:which Wireshark/TShark is running or as UTC and, for UTC, whether the[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1066:da[0m[39mte should be displayed as [0m[32m"[0m[32m{[0m[32mmonthname[0m[32m}[0m[32m [0m[32m{[0m[32mday_of_month[0m[32m}[0m[32m, [0m[32m{[0m[32myear[0m[32m}[0m[32m"[0m[39m or as[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1067[0m[39m:[0m[32m"[0m[32m{[0m[32myear/day_of_year[0m[32m}[0m[32m"[0m[39m.[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1068[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1069:Add[0m[39mitionally, BASE_NONE is used for [0m[32m'display'[0m[39m as a NULL-value. That is, for[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1070[0m[39m:non-integers other than FT_ABSOLUTE_TIME fields, and non-bitfield[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1071:F[0m[39mT_BOOLEANs, you'll want to use BASE_NONE in the [0m[32m'display'[0m[39m field. You may[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1072[0m[39m:not use BASE_NONE for integers.[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1073[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1074[0m[39m:It is possible that in the future we will record the endianness of[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1075[0m[39m:integers. If so, it is likely that we'll use a bitmask on the display field[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1076[0m[39m:so that integers would be represented as BEND|BASE_DEC or LEND|BASE_HEX.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1077:B[0m[39mut that has not happened yet; note that there are protocols for which[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1078[0m[39m:no endianness is specified, such as the X11 protocol and the DCE RPC[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1079[0m[39m:protocol, so it would not be possible to record the endianness of all[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1080[0m[39m:integral fields.[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1081[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1082[0m[39m:strings [0m[1;39m([0m[39mFIELDCONVERT[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1083[0m[39m:----------------------[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1084[0m[39m:-- value_string[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1085[0m[39m:Some integer fields, of type FT_UINT*, need labels to represent the true[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1086[0m[39m:value of a field. You could think of those fields as having an[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1087:e[0m[39mnumerated data type, rather than an integral data type.[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1088[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1089:A[0m[39m [0m[32m'value_string'[0m[39m structure is a way to map values to strings.[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1090[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1091[0m[39m:    typedef struct _value_string [0m[1;39m{[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1092[0m[39m:        uint32_t value;[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1093[0m[39m:        char    *strptr;[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1094[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m value_string;[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1095[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1096:F[0m[39mor fields of that type, you would declare an array of [0m[32m"value_string"[0m[39ms:[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1097[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1098[0m[39m:    static const value_string valstringname[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m = [0m[1;39m{[0m                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1099[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m INTVAL1, [0m[32m"Descriptive String 1"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1100[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m INTVAL2, [0m[32m"Descriptive String 2"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1101[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m,       NULL [0m[1;39m}[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1102[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m;[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1103[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1104[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m([0m[39mthe last entry in the array must have a NULL [0m[32m'strptr'[0m[39m value, to[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1105[0m[39m:indicate the end of the array[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. The [0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field would be set to[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1106[0m[39m:[0m[32m'VALS[0m[32m([0m[32mvalstringname[0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m.[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1107[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1108[0m[39m:If the field has a numeric rather than an enumerated type, the [0m[32m'strings'[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1109:f[0m[39mield would be set to NULL.[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1110[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1111[0m[39m:If BASE_SPECIAL_VALS is also applied to the display bitmask, then if the[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1112[0m[39m:numeric value of a field doesn't match any values in the value_string[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1113[0m[39m:then just the numeric value is displayed [0m[1;39m([0m[39mi.e. no [0m[32m"Unknown"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. This is[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1114[0m[39m:intended for use when the value_string only gives special names for[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1115:ce[0m[39mrtain field values and values not in the value_string are expected.[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1116[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1117[0m[39m:-- Extended value strings[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1118[0m[39m:You can also use an extended version of the value_string for faster lookups.[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1119[0m[39m:It requires a value_string array as input.[0m                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1120[0m[39m:If all of a contiguous range of values from min to max are present in the [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39marray[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1121[0m[39m:in ascending order the value will be used as a direct index into a [0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mvalue_string array.[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1122[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1123[0m[39m:If the values in the array are not contiguous [0m[1;39m([0m[39mie: there are [0m[32m"gaps"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, but are[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1124[0m[39m:in ascending order a binary search will be used.[0m                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1125[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1126[0m[39m:Note: [0m[32m"gaps"[0m[39m in a value_string array can be filled with [0m[32m"empty"[0m[39m entries eg:[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1127[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m{[0m[39mvalue, [0m[32m"Unknown"[0m[1;39m}[0m[39m so that direct access to the array is possible.[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1128[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1129[0m[39m:Note: the value_string array values are *unsigned*; IOW: [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m is greater than [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m.[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1130[0m[39m:      So:[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1131[0m[39m:      [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m-2[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m,  [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m,  [0m[1;36m2[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m; wrong:   linear search will be used [0m[1;39m([0m[39mnote gap[0m[1;39m)[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1132[0m[39m:      [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m  [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m,  [0m[1;36m2[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m-2[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m; correct: binary search will be used[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1133[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1134[0m[39m:      As a special case:[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1135[0m[39m:      [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m-2[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m,  [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m,  [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m,  [0m[1;36m2[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m; OK: [0m[1;35mdirect[0m[1;39m([0m[39mindexed[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m access will be used [0m[1;39m([0m[39mnote no[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mgap[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1136[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1137[0m[39m:The init macro [0m[1;39m([0m[39msee below[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m will perform a check on the value string the first[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1138[0m[39m:time it is used to determine which search algorithm fits and fall back to a[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1139[0m[39m:linear search if the value_string does not meet the criteria above.[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1140[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1141[0m[39m:Use this macro to initialize the extended value_string at compile time:[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1142[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1143[0m[39m:static value_string_ext valstringname_ext = [0m                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;35mVALUE_STRING_EXT_INIT[0m[1;39m([0m[39mvalstringname[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1144[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1145:E[0m[39mxtended value strings can be created at run time by calling[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1146[0m[39m:   [0m[1;35mvalue_string_ext_new[0m[1;39m([0m[39m<ptr to value_string array>,[0m                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1147[0m[39m:                        <total number of entries in the value_string_array>, [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [35m/[0m[39m* include [0m[1;39m{[0m[1;36m0[0m[39m, NULL[0m[1;39m}[0m[39m entry *[0m[35m/[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1148[0m[39m:                        <value_string_name>[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1149[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
