[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1150:F[0m[39mor hf[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m array [0m[1;35mFT_[0m[1;39m([0m[39mU[0m[1;39m)[0m[39mINT* fields that need a [0m[32m'valstringname_ext'[0m[39m struct, the[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1151[0m[39m:[0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field would be set to [0m[32m'&valstringname_ext'[0m[39m. Furthermore, the [0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [32m'display'[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1152:f[0m[39mield must be ORed with [0m[32m'BASE_EXT_STRING'[0m[39m [0m[1;39m([0m[39me.g. BASE_DEC|BASE_EXT_STRING[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1153[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1154[0m[39m:-- val64_string[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1155[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1156[0m[39m:val64_strings are like value_strings, except that the integer type[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1157[0m[39m:used is a uint64_t [0m[1;39m([0m[39minstead of uint32_t[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. Instead of using the [0m[1;35mVALS[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1158[0m[39m:macro for the [0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field in the header_field_info struct array,[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1159[0m[39m:[0m[32m'VALS64[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m is used.[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1160[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1161:BA[0m[39mSE_SPECIAL_VALS can also be used for val64_string.[0m                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1162[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1163[0m[39m:-- val64_string_ext[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1164[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1165[0m[39m:val64_string_ext is like value_string_ext, except that the integer type[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1166[0m[39m:used is a uint64_t [0m[1;39m([0m[39minstead of uint32_t[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1167[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1168[0m[39m:Use this macro to initialize the extended val64_string at compile time:[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1169[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1170[0m[39m:static val64_string_ext val64stringname_ext = [0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;35mVAL64_STRING_EXT_INIT[0m[1;39m([0m[39mval64stringname[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1171[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1172:E[0m[39mxtended val64 strings can be created at run time by calling[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1173[0m[39m:   [0m[1;35mval64_string_ext_new[0m[1;39m([0m[39m<ptr to val64_string array>,[0m                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1174[0m[39m:                        <total number of entries in the val64_string_array>, [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [35m/[0m[39m* include [0m[1;39m{[0m[1;36m0[0m[39m, NULL[0m[1;39m}[0m[39m entry *[0m[35m/[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1175[0m[39m:                        <val64_string_name>[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1176[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1177:F[0m[39mor hf[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m array [0m[1;35mFT_[0m[1;39m([0m[39mU[0m[1;39m)[0m[39mINT* fields that need a [0m[32m'val64stringname_ext'[0m[39m struct, the[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1178[0m[39m:[0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field would be set to [0m[32m'&val64stringname_ext'[0m[39m. Furthermore, the [0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [32m'display'[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1179:f[0m[39mield must be ORed with both [0m[32m'BASE_EXT_STRING'[0m[39m and [0m[32m'BASE_VAL64_STRING'[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1180[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m([0m[39me.g. BASE_DEC|BASE_EXT_STRING|BASE_VAL64_STRING[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1181[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1182[0m[39m:-- Unit string[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1183[0m[39m:Some integer fields, of type FT_UINT* and float fields, of type FT_FLOAT[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1184[0m[39m:or FT_DOUBLE, need units of measurement to help convey the field value.[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1185[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1186:A[0m[39m [0m[32m'unit_name_string'[0m[39m structure is a way to add a unit suffix to a field.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1187[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1188[0m[39m:    typedef struct unit_name_string [0m[1;39m{[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1189[0m[39m:        char *singular;     [0m[35m/[0m[39m* name to use for [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m unit *[0m[35m/[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1190[0m[39m:        char *plural;       [0m[35m/[0m[39m* name to use for < [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m or > [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m units *[0m[35m/[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1191[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m unit_name_string;[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1192[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1193:F[0m[39mor fields with that unit name, you would declare a [0m[32m"unit_name_string"[0m[39m:[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1194[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1195[0m[39m:    static const unit_name_string unitname[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m =[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1196[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[32m"single item name"[0m[39m , [0m[32m"multiple item name"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m;[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1197[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1198[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m([0m[39mthe second entry can be NULL if there is no plural form of the unit name.[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1199[0m[39m:This is typically the case when abbreviations are used instead of full words.[0m[1;39m)[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1200[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1201:F[0m[39mor hf[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m array [0m[1;35mFT_[0m[1;39m([0m[39mU[0m[1;39m)[0m[39mINT*, FT_FLOAT and FT_DOUBLE fields that need a[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1202[0m[39m:[0m[32m'unit_name_string'[0m[39m struct, the [0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field would be set to[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1203[0m[39m:[0m[32m'&unitname'[0m[39m. Furthermore, the [0m[32m'display'[0m[39m field must be ORed[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1204[0m[39m:with [0m[32m'BASE_UNIT_STRING'[0m[39m [0m[1;39m([0m[39me.g. BASE_DEC|BASE_UNIT_STRING[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1205[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1206[0m[39m:There are several [0m[32m"common"[0m[39m unit name structures already defined in[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1207:e[0m[39mpan/unit_strings.h, e.g. [0m[32m'units_second_seconds'[0m[39m. Dissector authors may choose[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1208[0m[39m:to add the unit name structure there rather than locally in a dissector.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1209[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1210[0m[39m:-- Ranges[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1211[0m[39m:If the field has a numeric type that might logically fit in ranges of values[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1212[0m[39m:one can use a range_string struct.[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1213[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1214[0m[39m:Thus a [0m[32m'range_string'[0m[39m structure is a way to map ranges to strings.[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1215[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1216[0m[39m:    typedef struct _range_string [0m[1;39m{[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1217[0m[39m:        uint32_t       value_min;[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1218[0m[39m:        uint32_t       value_max;[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1219[0m[39m:        const char    *strptr;[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1220[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m range_string;[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1221[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1222:F[0m[39mor fields of that type, you would declare an array of [0m[32m"range_string"[0m[39ms:[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1223[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1224[0m[39m:    static const range_string rvalstringname[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m = [0m[1;39m{[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1225[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m INTVAL_MIN1, INTVALMAX1, [0m[32m"Descriptive String 1"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1226[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m INTVAL_MIN2, INTVALMAX2, [0m[32m"Descriptive String 2"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1227[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m,           [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m,          NULL                   [0m[1;39m}[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1228[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m;[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1229[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1230[0m[39m:If INTVAL_MIN equals INTVAL_MAX for a given entry the range_string[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1231:be[0m[39mhavior collapses to the one of value_string. Note that each range_string[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1232[0m[39m:within the array is tested in order, so any [0m[32m'catch-all'[0m[39m entries need to come[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1233:af[0m[39mter specific individual entries.[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1234[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1235:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mFT_[0m[1;39m([0m[39mU[0m[1;39m)[0m[39mINT* fields that need a [0m[32m'range_string'[0m[39m struct, the [0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1236[0m[39m:would be set to [0m[32m'RVALS[0m[32m([0m[32mrvalstringname[0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m. Furthermore, [0m[32m'display'[0m[39m field must be[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1237[0m[39m:ORed with [0m[32m'BASE_RANGE_STRING'[0m[39m [0m[1;39m([0m[39me.g. BASE_DEC|BASE_RANGE_STRING[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1238[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1239[0m[39m:-- Booleans[0m                                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1240:F[0m[39mT_BOOLEANs have a default map of [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m = [0m[32m"False"[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m [0m[1;39m([0m[39mor anything else[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m = [0m[32m"True"[0m[39m.[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1241[0m[39m:Sometimes it is useful to change the labels for boolean values [0m[1;39m([0m[39me.g.,[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1242[0m[39m:to [0m[32m"Yes"[0m[35m/[0m[32m"No"[0m[39m, [0m[32m"Fast"[0m[35m/[0m[32m"Slow"[0m[39m, etc.[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. For these mappings, a struct called[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1243[0m[39m:true_false_string is used.[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1244[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1245[0m[39m:    typedef struct true_false_string [0m[1;39m{[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1246[0m[39m:        char    *true_string;[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1247[0m[39m:        char    *false_string;[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1248[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m true_false_string;[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1249[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1250:F[0m[39mor Boolean fields for which [0m[32m"False"[0m[39m and [0m[32m"True"[0m[39m aren't the desired[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1251[0m[39m:labels, you would declare a [0m[32m"true_false_string"[0m[39ms:[0m                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1252[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1253[0m[39m:    static const true_false_string boolstringname = [0m[1;39m{[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1254[0m[39m:        [0m[32m"String for True"[0m[39m,[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1255[0m[39m:        [0m[32m"String for False"[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1256[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m;[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1257[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1258[0m[39m:Its two fields are pointers to the string representing truth, and the[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1259[0m[39m:string representing falsehood. For FT_BOOLEAN fields that need a[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1260[0m[39m:[0m[32m'true_false_string'[0m[39m struct, the [0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field would be set to[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1261[0m[39m:[0m[32m'TFS[0m[32m([0m[32m&boolstringname[0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m.[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1262[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1263[0m[39m:If the Boolean field is to be displayed as [0m[32m"False"[0m[39m or [0m[32m"True"[0m[39m, the[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1264[0m[39m:[0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field would be set to NULL.[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1265[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1266[0m[39m:Wireshark predefines a whole range of ready made [0m[32m"true_false_string"[0m[39ms[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1267[0m[39m:in tfs.h, included via packet.h.[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1268[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1269[0m[39m:-- Custom[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1270:C[0m[39mustom fields [0m[1;39m([0m[39mBASE_CUSTOM[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m should use [0m[1;35mCF_FUNC[0m[1;39m([0m[39m&custom_format_func[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m for the[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1271[0m[39m:[0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field.[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1272[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1273[0m[39m:-- Frame numbers[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1274:F[0m[39mT_FRAMENUMs can use the [0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field to indicate their purpose by[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1275[0m[39m:setting the field to [0m[32m'FRAMENUM_TYPE[0m[32m([0m[32mx[0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m, where x is one of the values of[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1276[0m[39m:the ft_framenum_type enum:[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1277[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1278[0m[39m:    FT_FRAMENUM_NONE[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1279[0m[39m:    FT_FRAMENUM_REQUEST[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1280[0m[39m:    FT_FRAMENUM_RESPONSE[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1281[0m[39m:    FT_FRAMENUM_ACK[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1282[0m[39m:    FT_FRAMENUM_DUP_ACK[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1283[0m[39m:    FT_FRAMENUM_RETRANS_PREV[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1284[0m[39m:    FT_FRAMENUM_RETRANS_NEXT[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1285[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1286[0m[39m:The packet list uses the value to determine the related packet symbol to draw.[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1287[0m[39m:Note that [0m[32m'strings'[0m[39m field NULL is equal to [0m[1;35mFRAMENUM_TYPE[0m[1;39m([0m[39mFT_FRAMENUM_NONE[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1288[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1289[0m[39m:-- Note to plugin authors[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1290:Da[0m[39mta cannot get exported from DLLs. For this reason plugin authors cannot use[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1291:e[0m[39mxisting fieldconvert strings [0m[1;39m([0m[39me.g. from existing dissectors or those from[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1292:e[0m[39mpan/unit_strings.h[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. Plugins must define value_strings, unit_name_strings,[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1293[0m[39m:range_strings and true_false_strings locally.[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1294[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1295:b[0m[39mitmask [0m[1;39m([0m[39mBITMASK[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1296[0m[39m:-----------------[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1297[0m[39m:If the field is a bitfield, then the bitmask is the mask which will[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1298[0m[39m:leave only the bits needed to make the field when ANDed with a value.[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1299[0m[39m:The proto_tree routines will calculate [0m[32m'bitshift'[0m[39m automatically[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1300:f[0m[39mrom [0m[32m'bitmask'[0m[39m, by finding the rightmost set bit in the bitmask.[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1301[0m[39m:This shift is applied before applying string mapping functions or[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1302:f[0m[39miltering.[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1303[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1304[0m[39m:If the field is not a bitfield, then bitmask should be set to [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m.[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1305[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1306:b[0m[39mlurb [0m[1;39m([0m[39mFIELDDESCR[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1307[0m[39m:------------------[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1308[0m[39m:This is a string giving a proper description of the field. It should be[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1309:a[0m[39mt least one grammatically complete sentence, or NULL in which case the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1310[0m[39m:name field is used. [0m[1;39m([0m[39mPlease do not use [0m[32m""[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1311[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1312[0m[39m:It is meant to provide a more detailed description of the field than the[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1313[0m[39m:name alone provides. This information will be used in the man page, and[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1314[0m[39m:in a future GUI display-filter creation tool. We might also add tooltips[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1315[0m[39m:to the labels in the GUI protocol tree, in which case the blurb would[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1316:be[0m[39m used as the tooltip text.[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1317[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1318[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1319:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m5.1[0m[39m Field Registration.[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1320[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1321[0m[39m:Protocol registration is handled by creating an instance of the[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1322[0m[39m:header_field_info struct [0m[1;39m([0m[39mor an array of such structs[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, and[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1323:ca[0m[39mlling the registration function along with the registration ID of[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1324[0m[39m:the protocol that is the parent of the fields. Here is a complete example:[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1325[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1326[0m[39m:    static int proto_eg;[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1327[0m[39m:    static int hf_field_a;[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1328[0m[39m:    static int hf_field_b;[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1329[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1330[0m[39m:    static hf_register_info hf[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m = [0m[1;39m{[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1331[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m &hf_field_a,[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1332[0m[39m:            [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[32m"Field A"[0m[39m, [0m[32m"proto.field_a"[0m[39m, FT_UINT8, BASE_HEX, NULL,[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1333[0m[39m:                [0m[1;36m0xf0[0m[39m, [0m[32m"Field A represents Apples"[0m[39m, HFILL [0m[1;39m}[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1334[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1335[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1336[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m &hf_field_b,[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1337[0m[39m:            [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[32m"Field B"[0m[39m, [0m[32m"proto.field_b"[0m[39m, FT_UINT16, BASE_DEC, [0m[1;35mVALS[0m[1;39m([0m[39mvs[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m,[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1338[0m[39m:                [0m[1;36m0x0[0m[39m, [0m[32m"Field B represents Bananas"[0m[39m, HFILL [0m[1;39m}[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1339[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1340[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m;[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1341[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1342[0m[39m:    proto_eg = [0m[1;35mproto_register_protocol[0m[1;39m([0m[32m"Example Protocol"[0m[39m,[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1343[0m[39m:        [0m[32m"PROTO"[0m[39m, [0m[32m"proto"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1344[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_register_field_array[0m[1;39m([0m[39mproto_eg, hf, [0m[1;35marray_length[0m[1;39m([0m[39mhf[0m[1;39m)[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1345[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1346:Be[0m[39m sure that your array of hf_register_info structs is declared [0m[32m'static'[0m[39m,[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1347[0m[39m:since the [0m[1;35mproto_register_field_array[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function does not create a copy[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1348[0m[39m:of the information in the array[0m[33m...[0m[39m it uses that static copy of the[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1349[0m[39m:information that the compiler created inside your array. Here's the[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1350[0m[39m:layout of the hf_register_info struct:[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1351[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1352[0m[39m:typedef struct hf_register_info [0m[1;39m{[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1353[0m[39m:    int               *p_id; [0m[35m/[0m[39m* pointer to parent variable *[0m[35m/[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1354[0m[39m:    header_field_info  hfinfo;[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1355[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m}[0m[39m hf_register_info;[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1356[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1357:A[0m[39mlso be sure to use the handy [0m[1;35marray_length[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m macro found in packet.h[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1358[0m[39m:to have the compiler compute the array length for you at compile time.[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1359[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1360[0m[39m:If you don't have any fields to register, do *NOT* create a zero-length[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1361[0m[39m:[0m[32m"hf"[0m[39m array; not all compilers used to compile Wireshark support them.[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1362[0m[39m:Just omit the [0m[32m"hf"[0m[39m array, and the [0m[32m"proto_register_field_array[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m"[0m[39m call,[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1363:e[0m[39mntirely.[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1364[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1365[0m[39m:It is OK to have header fields with a different format be registered with[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1366[0m[39m:the same abbreviation. For instance, the following is valid:[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1367[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1368[0m[39m:    static hf_register_info hf[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m = [0m[1;39m{[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1369[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m &hf_field_8bit, [0m[35m/[0m[39m* [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m-bit version of proto.field *[0m[35m/[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1370[0m[39m:            [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[32m"Field [0m[32m([0m[32m8 bit[0m[32m)[0m[32m"[0m[39m, [0m[32m"proto.field"[0m[39m, FT_UINT8, BASE_DEC, NULL,[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1371[0m[39m:                [0m[1;36m0x00[0m[39m, [0m[32m"Field represents FOO"[0m[39m, HFILL [0m[1;39m}[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1372[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1373[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1374[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m &hf_field_32bit, [0m[35m/[0m[39m* [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit version of proto.field *[0m[35m/[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1375[0m[39m:            [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[32m"Field [0m[32m([0m[32m32 bit[0m[32m)[0m[32m"[0m[39m, [0m[32m"proto.field"[0m[39m, FT_UINT32, BASE_DEC, NULL,[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1376[0m[39m:                [0m[1;36m0x00[0m[39m, [0m[32m"Field represents FOO"[0m[39m, HFILL [0m[1;39m}[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1377[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1378[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m;[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1379[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1380[0m[39m:This way a filter expression can match a header field, irrespective of the[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1381[0m[39m:representation of it in the specific protocol context. This is interesting[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1382:f[0m[39mor protocols with variable-width header fields.[0m                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1383[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1384[0m[39m:Note that the formats used must all belong to the same group as defined below:[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1385[0m[39m:- FT_INT8, FT_INT16, FT_INT24 and FT_INT32, FT_CHAR, FT_UINT8, FT_UINT16,[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1386[0m[39m:  FT_UINT24, FT_UINT32, FT_IPXNET, FT_FRAMENUM, FT_INT40, FT_INT48, FT_INT56,[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1387[0m[39m:  FT_INT64, FT_UINT40, FT_UINT48, FT_UINT56 and FT_UINT64[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1388[0m[39m:- FT_ABSOLUTE_TIME and FT_RELATIVE_TIME[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1389[0m[39m:- FT_STRING, FT_STRINGZ, FT_UINT_STRING, FT_STRINGZPAD, FT_STRINGZTRUNC and [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mFT_AX25[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1390[0m[39m:- FT_FLOAT, FT_DOUBLE, FT_IEEE_11073_SFLOAT and FT_IEEE_11073_FLOAT[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1391[0m[39m:- FT_BYTES, FT_UINT_BYTES, FT_ETHER, FT_VINES, FT_FCWWN and FT_EUI64[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1392[0m[39m:- FT_OID, FT_REL_OID and FT_SYSTEM_ID[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1393[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1394:A[0m[39mny field not in a grouping above should *NOT* be used in duplicate field[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1395:abb[0m[39mreviations. The current code does not prevent it, but someday in the future[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1396[0m[39m:it might.[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1397[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1398[0m[39m:The HFILL macro at the end of the struct will set reasonable default values[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1399:f[0m[39mor internally used fields.[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1400[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1401:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m5.2[0m[39m Adding Items and Values to the Protocol Tree.[0m                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1402[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1403:A[0m[39m protocol item is added to an existing protocol tree with one of a[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1404[0m[39m:handful of [0m[1;35mproto_XXX_DO_YYY[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m functions.[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1405[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1406[0m[39m:Subtrees can be made with the [0m[1;35mproto_item_add_subtree[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function:[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1407[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1408[0m[39m:    item = [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[33m...[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1409[0m[39m:    new_tree = [0m[1;35mproto_item_add_subtree[0m[1;39m([0m[39mitem, tree_type[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1410[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1411[0m[39m:This will add a subtree under the item in question; a subtree can be[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1412:c[0m[39mreated under an item made by any of the [0m[32m"proto_tree_add_XXX"[0m[39m functions,[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1413[0m[39m:so that the tree can be given an arbitrary depth.[0m                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1414[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1415[0m[39m:Subtree types are integers, assigned by[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1416[0m[39m:[0m[32m"proto_register_subtree_array[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m"[0m[39m. To register subtree types, pass an[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1417:a[0m[39mrray of pointers to [0m[32m"int"[0m[39m variables to hold the subtree type values to[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1418[0m[39m:[0m[32m"proto_register_subtree_array[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m"[0m[39m:[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1419[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1420[0m[39m:    static int ett_eg;[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1421[0m[39m:    static int ett_field_a;[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1422[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1423[0m[39m:    static int *ett[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m = [0m[1;39m{[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1424[0m[39m:        &ett_eg,[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1425[0m[39m:        &ett_field_a[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1426[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m;[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1427[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1428[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_register_subtree_array[0m[1;39m([0m[39mett, [0m[1;35marray_length[0m[1;39m([0m[39mett[0m[1;39m)[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1429[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1430[0m[39m:in your [0m[32m"register"[0m[39m routine, just as you register the protocol and the[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1431:f[0m[39mields for that protocol.[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1432[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1433[0m[39m:The ett_ variables identify particular type of subtree so that if you expand[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1434[0m[39m:one of them, Wireshark keeps track of that and, when you click on[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1435:a[0m[39mnother packet, it automatically opens all subtrees of that type.[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1436[0m[39m:If you close one of them, all subtrees of that type will be closed when[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1437[0m[39m:you move to another packet.[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1438[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1439[0m[39m:There are many functions that the programmer can use to add either[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1440[0m[39m:protocol or field labels to the proto_tree, for example:[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1441[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1442[0m[39m:    proto_item *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1443[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, id, tvb, start, length, encoding[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1444[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1445[0m[39m:    proto_item *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1446[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item_ret_int[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, id, tvb, start, length, encoding,[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1447[0m[39m:        *retval[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1448[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1449[0m[39m:    proto_item *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1450[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_subtree[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, tvb, start, length, idx, tree_item,[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1451[0m[39m:        text[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1452[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1453[0m[39m:    proto_item *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1454[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_int_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, id, tvb, start, length,[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1455[0m[39m:        value, format, [0m[33m...[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1456[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1457[0m[39m:    proto_item *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1458[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_checksum[0m[1;39m([0m[39mproto_tree *tree, tvbuff_t *tvb, const unsigned [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39moffset,[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1459[0m[39m:        const int hf_checksum, const int hf_checksum_status,[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1460[0m[39m:        struct expert_field* bad_checksum_expert, packet_info *pinfo,[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1461[0m[39m:        uint32_t computed_checksum, const unsigned encoding, const unsigned [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mflags[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1462[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1463[0m[39m:    proto_item *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1464[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, tvb, start, header, ett, fields,[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1465[0m[39m:        encoding[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1466[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1467[0m[39m:    proto_item *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1468[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bits_item[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, id, tvb, bit_offset, no_of_bits,[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1469[0m[39m:        encoding[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1470[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1471[0m[39m:The [0m[32m'tree'[0m[39m argument is the tree to which the item is to be added. The[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1472[0m[39m:[0m[32m'tvb'[0m[39m argument is the tvbuff from which the item's value is being[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1473:e[0m[39mxtracted; the [0m[32m'start'[0m[39m argument is the offset from the beginning of that[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1474[0m[39m:tvbuff of the item being added, and the [0m[32m'length'[0m[39m argument is the length,[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1475[0m[39m:in bytes, of the item, bit_offset is the offset in bits and no_of_bits[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1476[0m[39m:is the length in bits.[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1477[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1478[0m[39m:The length of some items cannot be determined until the item has been[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1479:d[0m[39missected; to add such an item, add it with a length of [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m, and, when the[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1480:d[0m[39missection is complete, set the length with [0m[32m'proto_item_set_len[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m:[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1481[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1482[0m[39m:    void[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1483[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_item_set_len[0m[1;39m([0m[39mti, length[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1484[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1485[0m[39m:The [0m[32m"ti"[0m[39m argument is the value returned by the call that added the item[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1486[0m[39m:to the tree, and the [0m[32m"length"[0m[39m argument is the length of the item.[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1487[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1488:A[0m[39mll available protocol tree functions are declared in epan/proto.h, with[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1489[0m[39m:their documentation. The details of these functions and their parameters[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1490:a[0m[39mre described below.[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1491[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1492[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1493[0m[39m:---------------------[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1494[0m[39m:proto_tree_add_item is used when you wish to do no special formatting.[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1495[0m[39m:The item added to the GUI tree will contain the name [0m[1;39m([0m[39mas passed in the[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1496[0m[39m:proto_register_*[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m and a value. The value will be fetched[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1497:f[0m[39mrom the tvbuff by [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, based on the type of the field[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1498:a[0m[39mnd the encoding of the value as specified by the [0m[32m"encoding"[0m[39m argument.[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1499[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1500:F[0m[39mor FT_NONE, FT_BYTES, FT_ETHER, FT_IPv6, FT_IPXNET, FT_OID, FT_REL_OID,[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1501:F[0m[39mT_AX25, FT_VINES, FT_SYSTEM_ID, FT_FCWWN fields, and [0m[32m'protocol'[0m[39m fields[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1502[0m[39m:the encoding is not relevant; the [0m[32m'encoding'[0m[39m argument should be[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1503:E[0m[39mNC_NA [0m[1;39m([0m[39mNot Applicable[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1504[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1505:F[0m[39mor FT_UINT_BYTES fields, the byte order of the count must be specified[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1506:a[0m[39ms well as the [0m[32m'encoding'[0m[39m for bytes which should be ENC_NA,[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1507[0m[39m:i.e. ENC_LITTLE_ENDIAN|ENC_NA[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1508[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1509:F[0m[39mor integral, floating-point, Boolean, FT_GUID, and FT_EUI64 fields,[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1510[0m[39m:the encoding specifies the byte order of the value; the [0m[32m'encoding'[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1511:a[0m[39mrgument should be ENC_LITTLE_ENDIAN if the value is little-endian[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1512:a[0m[39mnd ENC_BIG_ENDIAN if it is big-endian.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1513[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1514:F[0m[39mor FT_IPv4 fields, the encoding also specifies the byte order of the[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1515[0m[39m:value. In almost all cases, the encoding is in network byte order,[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1516[0m[39m:hence big-endian, but in at least one protocol dissected by Wireshark,[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1517:a[0m[39mt least one IPv4 address is byte-swapped, so it's in little-endian[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1518[0m[39m:order.[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1519[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1520:F[0m[39mor string fields, the encoding specifies the character set used for the[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1521[0m[39m:string and the way individual code points in that character set are[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1522:e[0m[39mncoded. For FT_UINT_STRING fields, the byte order of the count must be[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1523[0m[39m:specified. For UTF-[0m[1;36m16[0m[39m, UCS-[0m[1;36m2[0m[39m, and UCS-[0m[1;36m4[0m[39m, the byte order of the encoding[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1524[0m[39m:must be specified, and optionally ENC_BOM can also be indicated to detect[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1525:a[0m[39mn initial BYTE ORDER MARK [0m[1;39m([0m[39mthe specified value is used if the field does[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1526[0m[39m:not begin with a BOM.[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m For counted UTF-[0m[1;36m16[0m[39m, UCS-[0m[1;36m2[0m[39m, and UCS-[0m[1;36m4[0m[39m strings, the[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1527:b[0m[39myte order of the count and the characters in the string must be the same,[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1528[0m[39m:unless a BOM overrides the value for the characters. In other cases the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1529[0m[39m:string encoding has no endianness or the endianness is implicitly specified[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1530:a[0m[39mnd nothing should be used. The character encodings that are currently[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1531[0m[39m:supported are:[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1532[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1533[0m[39m:    ENC_ASCII - ASCII [0m[1;39m([0m[39mcurrently treated as UTF-[0m[1;36m8[0m[39m; in the future,[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1534[0m[39m:        all bytes with the 8th bit set will be treated as[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1535[0m[39m:        errors[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1536[0m[39m:    ENC_UTF_8 - UTF-[0m[1;36m8[0m[39m-encoded Unicode[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1537[0m[39m:    ENC_UTF_16 - UTF-[0m[1;36m16[0m[39m-encoded Unicode, with surrogate pairs[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1538[0m[39m:    ENC_UCS_2 - UCS-[0m[1;36m2[0m[39m-encoded subset of Unicode, with no surrogate pairs[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1539[0m[39m:        and thus no code points above [0m[1;36m0xFFFF[0m                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1540[0m[39m:    ENC_UCS_4 - UCS-[0m[1;36m4[0m[39m-encoded Unicode [0m[1;39m([0m[39maka UTF-[0m[1;36m32[0m[1;39m)[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1541[0m[39m:    ENC_WINDOWS_1250 - Windows-[0m[1;36m1250[0m[39m code page[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1542[0m[39m:    ENC_WINDOWS_1251 - Windows-[0m[1;36m1251[0m[39m code page[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1543[0m[39m:    ENC_WINDOWS_1252 - Windows-[0m[1;36m1252[0m[39m code page[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1544[0m[39m:    ENC_ISO_646_BASIC - ISO [0m[1;36m646[0m[39m [0m[32m"basic code table"[0m                             [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1560[0m[39m:    ENC_3GPP_TS_23_038_7BITS - GSM [0m[1;36m7[0m[39m bits alphabet as described[0m                [2m                [0m
