[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1587[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1588:F[0m[39mor FT_ABSOLUTE_TIME fields, the encoding specifies the form in which[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1589[0m[39m:the time stamp is specified, as well as its byte order. The time stamp[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1590:e[0m[39mncodings that are currently supported are:[0m                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1591[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1592[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_SECS_NSECS - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m12[0m[39m, or [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m bytes. For [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, the first [0m[1;36m4[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1593[0m[39m:        bytes are seconds and the next [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are nanoseconds; for [0m[1;36m12[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1594[0m[39m:        bytes, the first [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes are seconds and the next [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1595[0m[39m:        nanoseconds; for [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m bytes, the first [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes are seconds and[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1596[0m[39m:        the next [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes are nanoseconds. The seconds are seconds[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1597[0m[39m:        since the UN*X epoch [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m1970[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m01[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m01[0m[39m [0m[1;92m00:00:00[0m[39m UTC[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. [0m[1;39m([0m[39mI.e., a UN*X[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1598[0m[39m:        struct timespec with a [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m-byte or [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m-byte time_t or a structure[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1599[0m[39m:        with an [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m-byte time_t and an [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m-byte nanoseconds field.[0m[1;39m)[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1600[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1601[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_NTP - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes; the first [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are seconds since the NTP[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1602[0m[39m:        epoch [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m1900[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m01[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m01[0m[39m [0m[1;92m00:00:00[0m[39m GMT[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m and the next [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m/[0m[1;36m2[0m[39m^[0m[1;36m32[0m[39m's of[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1603[0m[39m:        a second since that second. [0m[1;39m([0m[39mI.e., a [0m[1;36m64[0m[39m-bit count of [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m/[0m[1;36m2[0m[39m^[0m[1;36m32[0m[39m's of a[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1604[0m[39m:        second since the NTP epoch, with the upper [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m bits first and the[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1605[0m[39m:        lower [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m bits second, even when little-endian.[0m[1;39m)[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1606[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1607[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_TOD - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, as a count of microseconds since the System/3x0[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1608[0m[39m:        and z/Architecture epoch [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m1900[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m01[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m01[0m[39m [0m[1;92m00:00:00[0m[39m GMT[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1609[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1610[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_RTPS - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes; the first [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are seconds since the UN*X[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1611[0m[39m:        epoch and the next [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m/[0m[1;36m2[0m[39m^[0m[1;36m32[0m[39m's of a second since that[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1612[0m[39m:        second. [0m[1;39m([0m[39mI.e., it's the offspring of a mating between UN*X time and[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1613[0m[39m:        NTP time[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. It's used by the Object Management Group's Real-Time[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1614[0m[39m:        Publish-Subscribe Wire Protocol for the Data Distribution Service.[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1615[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1616[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_SECS_USECS - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes; the first [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are seconds since the[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1617[0m[39m:        UN*X epoch and the next [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are microseconds since that[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1618[0m[39m:        second. [0m[1;39m([0m[39mI.e., a UN*X struct timeval with a [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m-byte time_t.[0m[1;39m)[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1619[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1620[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_SECS - [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m to [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a value in seconds since[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1621[0m[39m:        the UN*X epoch.[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1622[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1623[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_MSECS - [0m[1;36m6[0m[39m to [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a value in milliseconds[0m        [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1626[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_USECS - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a value in microseconds since[0m       [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1629[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_NSECS - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a value in nanoseconds since[0m        [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1632[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_SECS_NTP - [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes, representing a count of seconds since[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1633[0m[39m:        the NTP epoch.[0m                                                         [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1635[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_RFC_3971 - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a count of [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m/64ths of a[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1636[0m[39m:        second since the UN*X epoch; see section [0m[1;36m5.3[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m1[0m[39m [0m[32m"Timestamp Option"[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1637[0m[39m:        in RFC [0m[1;36m3971[0m[39m.[0m                                                           [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1639[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_MSEC_NTP - [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a count of milliseconds since[0m  [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1641[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1642[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_MIP6 - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes; the first [0m[1;36m48[0m[39m bits are seconds since the UN*X [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mepoch[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1643[0m[39m:        and the remaining [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m bits indicate the number of [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m/[0m[1;36m65536[0m[39m's of a second[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1644[0m[39m:        since that second.[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1645[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1646[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_CLASSIC_MAC_OS_SECS - [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a count of seconds[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1647[0m[39m:        since January [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m1904[0m[39m, [0m[1;92m00:00:00[0m[39m UTC.[0m                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1648[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1649:F[0m[39mor FT_RELATIVE_TIME fields, the encoding specifies the form in which[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1650[0m[39m:the time stamp is specified, as well as its byte order. The time stamp[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1651:e[0m[39mncodings that are currently supported are:[0m                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1652[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1653[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_SECS_NSECS - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m12[0m[39m, or [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m bytes. For [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, the first [0m[1;36m4[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1654[0m[39m:        bytes are seconds and the next [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are nanoseconds; for [0m[1;36m12[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1655[0m[39m:        bytes, the first [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes are seconds and the next [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1656[0m[39m:        nanoseconds; for [0m[1;36m16[0m[39m bytes, the first [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes are seconds and[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1657[0m[39m:        the next [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes are nanoseconds.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1658[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1659[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_SECS_USECS - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes; the first [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are seconds and the[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1660[0m[39m:        next [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m bytes are microseconds.[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1661[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1662[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_SECS - [0m[1;36m4[0m[39m to [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a value in seconds.[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1663[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1664[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_MSECS - [0m[1;36m6[0m[39m to [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a value in milliseconds.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1665[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1666[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_USECS - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a value in microseconds.[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1667[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1668[0m[39m:    ENC_TIME_NSECS - [0m[1;36m8[0m[39m bytes, representing a value in nanoseconds.[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1669[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1670:F[0m[39mor other types, there is no support for [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1671[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1672[0m[39m:Now that definitions of fields have detailed information about bitfield[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1673:f[0m[39mields, you can use [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m with no extra processing to[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1674:add[0m[39m bitfield values to your tree. Here's an example. Take the Format[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1675[0m[39m:Identifier [0m[1;39m([0m[39mFID[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m field in the Transmission Header [0m[1;39m([0m[39mTH[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m portion of the SNA[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1676[0m[39m:protocol. The FID is the high nibble of the first byte of the TH. The[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1677:F[0m[39mID would be registered like this:[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1678[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1679[0m[39m:    name        = [0m[32m"Format Identifier"[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1680[0m[39m:    abbrev      = [0m[32m"sna.th.fid"[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1681[0m[39m:    type        = FT_UINT8[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1682[0m[39m:    display     = BASE_HEX[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1683[0m[39m:    strings     = sna_th_fid_vals[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1684[0m[39m:    bitmask     = [0m[1;36m0xf0[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1685[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1686[0m[39m:The bitmask contains the value which would leave only the FID if bitwise-ANDed[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1687:a[0m[39mgainst the parent field, the first byte of the TH.[0m                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1688[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1689[0m[39m:The code to add the FID to the tree would be;[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1690[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1691[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[39mbf_tree, hf_sna_th_fid, tvb, offset, [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m,[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1692[0m[39m:        ENC_BIG_ENDIAN[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1693[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1694[0m[39m:The definition of the field already has the information about bitmasking[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1695:a[0m[39mnd bitshifting, so it does the work of masking and shifting for us![0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1696[0m[39m:This also means that you no longer have to create value_string structs[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1697[0m[39m:with the values bitshifted. The value_string for FID looks like this,[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1698:e[0m[39mven though the FID value is actually contained in the high nibble.[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1699[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m([0m[39mYou'd expect the values to be [0m[1;36m0x0[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m0x10[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m0x20[0m[39m, etc.[0m[1;39m)[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1700[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1701[0m[39m:[0m[35m/[0m[39m* Format Identifier *[0m[35m/[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1702[0m[39m:static const value_string sna_th_fid_vals[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m = [0m[1;39m{[0m                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1703[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0x0[0m[39m, [0m[32m"SNA device <--> Non-SNA Device"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1704[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0x1[0m[39m, [0m[32m"Subarea Node <--> Subarea Node"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1705[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0x2[0m[39m, [0m[32m"Subarea Node <--> PU2"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1706[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0x3[0m[39m, [0m[32m"Subarea Node or SNA host <--> Subarea Node"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1707[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0x4[0m[39m, [0m[32m"?"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1708[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0x5[0m[39m, [0m[32m"?"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1709[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0xf[0m[39m, [0m[32m"Adjacent Subarea Nodes"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1710[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m, NULL [0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1711[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m}[0m[39m;[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1712[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1713[0m[39m:The final implication of this is that display filters work the way you'd[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1714[0m[39m:naturally expect them to. You'd type [0m[32m"sna.th.fid == 0xf"[0m[39m to find Adjacent[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1715[0m[39m:Subarea Nodes. The user does not have to shift the value of the FID to[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1716[0m[39m:the high nibble of the byte [0m[1;39m([0m[32m"sna.th.fid == 0xf0"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m as was necessary[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1717[0m[39m:in the past.[0m                                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1718[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1719[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item_ret_XXX[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1720[0m[39m:------------------------------[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1721[0m[39m:proto_tree_add_item_ret_XXX is used when you want the displayed value returned[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1722:f[0m[39mor further processing only integer and unsigned integer types up to [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m bits [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mare[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1723[0m[39m:supported usage of proper FT_ is checked.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1724[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1725[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_XXX_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1726[0m[39m:---------------------[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1727[0m[39m:proto_tree_add_XXX_item is used when you wish to do no special formatting,[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1728:b[0m[39mut also either wish for the retrieved value from the tvbuff to be handed[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1729:bac[0m[39mk [0m[1;39m([0m[39mto avoid doing tvb_get_[0m[33m...[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, and/or wish to have the value be decoded[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1730:f[0m[39mrom the tvbuff in a string-encoded format.[0m                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1731[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1732[0m[39m:The item added to the GUI tree will contain the name [0m[1;39m([0m[39mas passed in the[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1733[0m[39m:proto_register_*[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m and a value. The value will be fetched[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1734:f[0m[39mrom the tvbuff, based on the type of the XXX name and the encoding of[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1735[0m[39m:the value as specified by the [0m[32m"encoding"[0m[39m argument.[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1736[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1737[0m[39m:This function retrieves the value even if the passed-in tree param is NULL,[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1738[0m[39m:so that it can be used by dissectors at all times to both get the value[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1739:a[0m[39mnd set the tree item to it.[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1740[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1741[0m[39m:Like other proto_tree_add functions, if there is a tree and the value cannot[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1742:be[0m[39m decoded from the tvbuff, then an expert info error is reported. For string[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1743:e[0m[39mncoding, this means that a failure to decode the hex value from the string[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1744[0m[39m:results in an expert info error being added to the tree.[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1745[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1746:F[0m[39mor string-decoding, the passed-in encoding argument needs to specify the[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1747[0m[39m:string encoding [0m[1;39m([0m[39me.g., ENC_ASCII, ENC_UTF_8[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m as well as the format. For[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1748[0m[39m:some XXX types, the format is constrained - for example for the encoding [0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mformat[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1749:f[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_time_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m can only be one of the ENC_ISO_8601_* ones[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1750[0m[39m:or ENC_IMF_DATE_TIME. For [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bytes_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m if ENC_STR_HEX is used[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1751[0m[39m:it must be bit-or'ed with one or more of the ENC_SEP_* separator types.[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1752[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1753[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_protocol_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1754[0m[39m:--------------------------------[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1755[0m[39m:proto_tree_add_protocol_format is used to add the top-level item for the[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1756[0m[39m:protocol when the dissector routine wants complete control over how the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1757:f[0m[39mield and value will be represented on the GUI tree. The ID value for[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1758[0m[39m:the protocol is passed in as the [0m[32m"id"[0m[39m argument; the rest of the[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1759:a[0m[39mrguments are a [0m[32m"printf"[0m[39m-style format and any arguments for that format.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1760[0m[39m:The caller must include the name of the protocol in the format; it is[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1761[0m[39m:not added automatically as in [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1762[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1763[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_none_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1764[0m[39m:----------------------------[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1765[0m[39m:proto_tree_add_none_format is used to add an item of type FT_NONE.[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1766[0m[39m:The caller must include the name of the field in the format; it is[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1767[0m[39m:not added automatically as in [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1768[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1769[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bytes[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1770[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_time[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1771[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipxnet[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1772[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipv4[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1773[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipv6[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1774[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ether[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1775[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_string[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1776[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_boolean[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1777[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_float[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1778[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_double[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1779[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_uint[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1780[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_uint64[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1781[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_int[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1782[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_int64[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1783[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_guid[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1784[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_oid[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1785[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_eui64[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1786[0m[39m:------------------------[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1787[0m[39m:These routines are used to add items to the protocol tree if either:[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1788[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1789[0m[39m:    the value of the item to be added isn't just extracted from the[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1790[0m[39m:    packet data, but is computed from data in the packet;[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1791[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1792[0m[39m:    the value was fetched into a variable.[0m                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1793[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1794[0m[39m:The [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument has the value to be added to the tree.[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1795[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1796[0m[39m:NOTE: in all cases where the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a pointer, a copy is[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1797[0m[39m:made of the object pointed to; if you have dynamically allocated a[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1798:b[0m[39muffer for the object, that buffer will not be freed when the protocol[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1799[0m[39m:tree is freed - you must free the buffer yourself when you don't need it[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1800:a[0m[39mny more.[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1801[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1802:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bytes[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value_ptr'[0m[39m argument is a pointer to a[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1803[0m[39m:sequence of bytes.[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1804[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1805[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1806[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bytes_with_length[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m is similar to proto_tree_add_bytes,[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1807:e[0m[39mxcept that the length is not derived from the tvb length. Instead,[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1808[0m[39m:the displayed data size is controlled by [0m[32m'ptr_length'[0m[39m.[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1809[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1810:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bytes_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m and [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bytes_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1811[0m[39m:[0m[32m'value_ptr'[0m[39m argument is a pointer to a sequence of bytes or NULL if the bytes[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1812[0m[39m:should be taken from the given TVB using the given offset and length.[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1813[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1814:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_time[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value_ptr'[0m[39m argument is a pointer to an[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1815[0m[39m:[0m[32m"nstime_t"[0m[39m, which is a structure containing the time to be added; it has[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1816[0m[39m:[0m[32m'secs'[0m[39m and [0m[32m'nsecs'[0m[39m members, giving the integral part and the fractional[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1817[0m[39m:part of a time in units of seconds, with [0m[32m'nsecs'[0m[39m being the number of[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1818[0m[39m:nanoseconds. For absolute times, [0m[32m"secs"[0m[39m is a UNIX-style seconds since[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1819[0m[39m:January [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m1970[0m[39m, [0m[1;92m00:00:00[0m[39m GMT value.[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1820[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1821:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipxnet[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit IPX[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1822[0m[39m:network address.[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1823[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1824:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipv4[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit IPv4[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1825:add[0m[39mress, in network byte order.[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1826[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1827:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipv6[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value_ptr'[0m[39m argument is a pointer to a[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1828:128[0m[39m-bit IPv6 address.[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1829[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1830:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ether[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value_ptr'[0m[39m argument is a pointer to a[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1831:48[0m[39m-bit MAC address.[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1832[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1833:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_string[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value_ptr'[0m[39m argument is a pointer to a[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1834[0m[39m:text string; this string must be NULL terminated even if the string in the[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1835[0m[39m:TVB is not [0m[1;39m([0m[39mas may be the case with FT_STRINGs[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1836[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1837:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_boolean[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit integer.[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1838[0m[39m:It is masked and shifted as defined by the field info after which zero[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1839[0m[39m:means [0m[32m"false"[0m[39m, and non-zero means [0m[32m"true"[0m[39m.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1840[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1841:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_float[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a [0m[32m'float'[0m[39m in the[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1842[0m[39m:host's floating-point format.[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1843[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1844:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_double[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a [0m[32m'double'[0m[39m in the[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1845[0m[39m:host's floating-point format.[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1846[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1847:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_uint[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit unsigned[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1848[0m[39m:integer value, in host byte order. [0m[1;39m([0m[39mThis routine cannot be used to add[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1849:64[0m[39m-bit integers.[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1850[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1851:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_uint64[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a [0m[1;36m64[0m[39m-bit unsigned[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1852[0m[39m:integer value, in host byte order.[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1853[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1854:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_int[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a [0m[1;36m32[0m[39m-bit signed[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1855[0m[39m:integer value, in host byte order. [0m[1;39m([0m[39mThis routine cannot be used to add[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1856:64[0m[39m-bit integers.[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1857[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1858:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_int64[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a [0m[1;36m64[0m[39m-bit signed[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1859[0m[39m:integer value, in host byte order.[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1860[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1861:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_guid[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value_ptr'[0m[39m argument is a pointer to an[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1862:e[0m[39m_guid_t structure.[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1863[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1864:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_oid[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value_ptr'[0m[39m argument is a pointer to an[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1865:A[0m[39mSN.[0m[1;36m1[0m[39m Object Identifier.[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1866[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1867:F[0m[39mor [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_eui64[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, the [0m[32m'value'[0m[39m argument is a [0m[1;36m64[0m[39m-bit unsigned[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1868[0m[39m:integer value, in host byte order.[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1869[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1870[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bytes_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1871[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_time_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1872[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipxnet_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1873[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipv4_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1874[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipv6_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1875[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ether_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1876[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_string_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1877[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_boolean_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1878[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_float_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1879[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_double_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1880[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_uint_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1881[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_uint64_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1882[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_int_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1883[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_int64_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1884[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_guid_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1885[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_oid_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1886[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_eui64_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1887[0m[39m:----------------------------[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1888[0m[39m:These routines are used to add items to the protocol tree when the[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1889:d[0m[39missector routine wants complete control over how the field and value[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1890[0m[39m:will be represented on the GUI tree. The argument giving the value is[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1891[0m[39m:the same as the corresponding [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_XXX[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function; the rest of[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1892[0m[39m:the arguments are a [0m[32m"printf"[0m[39m-style format and any arguments for that[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1893:f[0m[39mormat. The caller must include the name of the field in the format; it[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1894[0m[39m:is not added automatically as in the [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_XXX[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m functions.[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1895[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1896[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bytes_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1897[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_time_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1898[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipxnet_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1899[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipv4_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1900[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ipv6_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1901[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ether_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1902[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_string_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1903[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_boolean_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1904[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_float_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1905[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_double_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1906[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_uint_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1907[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_uint64_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1908[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_int_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1909[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_int64_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1910[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_guid_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1911[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_oid_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1912[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_eui64_format_value[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1913[0m[39m:------------------------------------[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1914[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1915[0m[39m:These routines are used to add items to the protocol tree when the[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1916:d[0m[39missector routine wants complete control over how the value will be[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1917[0m[39m:represented on the GUI tree. The argument giving the value is the same[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1918:a[0m[39ms the corresponding [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_XXX[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function; the rest of the[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1919:a[0m[39mrguments are a [0m[32m"printf"[0m[39m-style format and any arguments for that format.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1920[0m[39m:With these routines, unlike the [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_XXX_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m routines,[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1921[0m[39m:the name of the field is added automatically as in the[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1922[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_XXX[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m functions; only the value is added with the format.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1923[0m[39m:One use case for this would be to add a unit of measurement string to[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1924[0m[39m:the value of the field, however using BASE_UNIT_STRING in the hf_[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1925:def[0m[39minition is now preferred.[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1926[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1927[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_checksum[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1928[0m[39m:----------------------------[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1929[0m[39m:proto_tree_add_checksum is used to add a checksum field. The hf field[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1930[0m[39m:provided must be the correct size of the checksum [0m[1;39m([0m[39mFT_UINT, FT_UINT16,[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1931:F[0m[39mT_UINT32, etc[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. Additional parameters are there to provide [0m[32m"status"[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1932:a[0m[39mnd expert info depending on whether the checksum matches the provided[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1933[0m[39m:value. The [0m[32m"status"[0m[39m and expert info can be used in cases except[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1934[0m[39m:where PROTO_CHECKSUM_NO_FLAGS is used.[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1935[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1936[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_subtree[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1937[0m[39m:---------------------[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1938[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_subtree[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m is used to add a label to the GUI tree and create[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1939:a[0m[39m subtree for other fields. It will contain no value, so it is not searchable[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1940[0m[39m:in the display filter process.[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1941[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1942[0m[39m:This should only be used for items with subtrees, which may not[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1943[0m[39m:have values themselves - the items in the subtree are the ones with values.[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1944[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1945:F[0m[39mor a subtree, the label on the subtree might reflect some of the items[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1946[0m[39m:in the subtree. This means the label can't be set until at least some[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1947[0m[39m:of the items in the subtree have been dissected. To do this, use[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1948[0m[39m:[0m[32m'proto_item_set_text[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m or [0m[32m'proto_item_append_text[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m:[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1949[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1950[0m[39m:    void[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1951[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_item_set_text[0m[1;39m([0m[39mproto_item *ti, [0m[33m...[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1952[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1953[0m[39m:    void[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1954[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_item_append_text[0m[1;39m([0m[39mproto_item *ti, [0m[33m...[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1955[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1956[0m[39m:[0m[32m'proto_item_set_text[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m takes as an argument the proto_item value returned by[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1957[0m[39m:one of the parameters in [0m[32m'proto_tree_add_subtree[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m, a [0m[32m'printf'[0m[39m-style format[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1958[0m[39m:string, and a set of arguments corresponding to [0m[32m'%'[0m[39m format items in that [0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mstring,[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1959:a[0m[39mnd replaces the text for the item created by [0m[32m'proto_tree_add_subtree[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m with [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mthe result[0m                                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1960[0m[39m:of applying the arguments to the format string.[0m                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1961[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1962[0m[39m:[0m[32m'proto_item_append_text[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m is similar, but it appends to the text for[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1963[0m[39m:the item the result of applying the arguments to the format string.[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1964[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1965:F[0m[39mor example, early in the dissection, one might do:[0m                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1966[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1967[0m[39m:    subtree = [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_subtree[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, tvb, offset, length, ett, &ti, [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<label>[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1968[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1969:a[0m[39mnd later do[0m                                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1970[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1971[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_item_set_text[0m[1;39m([0m[39mti, [0m[32m"%s: %s"[0m[39m, type, value[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1972[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1973:af[0m[39mter the [0m[32m"type"[0m[39m and [0m[32m"value"[0m[39m fields have been extracted and dissected.[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1974[0m[39m:<label> would be a label giving what information about the subtree is[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1975:a[0m[39mvailable without dissecting any of the data in the subtree.[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1976[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1977[0m[39m:Note that an exception might be thrown when trying to extract the values of[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1978[0m[39m:the items used to set the label, if not all the bytes of the item are[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1979:a[0m[39mvailable. Thus, one should create the item with text that is as[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1980[0m[39m:meaningful as possible, and set it or append additional information to[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1981[0m[39m:it as the values needed to supply that information are extracted.[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1982[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1983[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_subtree_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1984[0m[39m:----------------------------[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1985[0m[39m:This is like [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_subtree[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, but uses printf-style arguments to[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1986:c[0m[39mreate the label; it is used to allow routines that take a printf-like[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1987[0m[39m:variable-length list of arguments to add a text item to the protocol[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1988[0m[39m:tree.[0m                                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1989[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1990[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bits_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1991[0m[39m:--------------------------[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1992:Add[0m[39ms a number of bits to the protocol tree which does not have to be byte[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m1993:a[0m[39mligned. The offset and length is in bits.[0m                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1994[0m[39m:Output format:[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1995[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1996[0m[39m:..[0m[1;36m10[0m[39m [0m[1;36m1010[0m[39m [0m[1;36m10[0m[39m.. [0m[33m...[0m[39m. [0m[32m"value"[0m[39m [0m[1;39m([0m[39mformatted as FT_ indicates[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1997[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1998[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bits_ret_val[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1999[0m[39m:-----------------------------[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2000[0m[39m:Works in the same way but also returns the value of the read bits.[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2001[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2002[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_split_bits_item_ret_val[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2003[0m[39m:-----------------------------------[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2004[0m[39m:Similar, but is used for items that are made of [0m[1;36m2[0m[39m or more smaller sets of bits[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;39m([0m[39mcrumbs[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2005[0m[39m:which are not contiguous, but are concatenated to form the actual value. The [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39msize of[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2006[0m[39m:the crumbs and the order of assembly are specified in an array of crumb_spec [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mstructures.[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2007[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2008[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_split_bits_crumb[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2009[0m[39m:---------------------------------[0m                                              [2m                [0m
