[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2010[0m[39m:Helper function for the above, to add text for each crumb as it is [0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mencountered.[0m                                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2011[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2012[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_ts_23_038_7bits_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2013[0m[39m:-------------------------------------[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2014:Add[0m[39ms a string of a given number of characters and encoded according to 3GPP TS[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m23.038[0m[39m [0m[1;36m7[0m[39m bits[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2015:a[0m[39mlphabet.[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2016[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2017[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m et al.[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2018[0m[39m:-------------------------------[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2019[0m[39m:These functions provide easy to use and convenient dissection of many types of[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mcommon[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2020:b[0m[39mitmasks into individual fields.[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2021[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2022[0m[39m:header is an integer type and must be of type [0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mFT_[0m[1;39m[[0m[39mU[0m[1;39m][0m[39mINT[0m[1;39m{[0m[1;36m8[0m[39m|[0m[1;36m16[0m[39m|[0m[1;36m24[0m[39m|[0m[1;36m32[0m[39m||[0m[1;36m40[0m[39m|[0m[1;36m48[0m[39m|[0m[1;36m56[0m[39m|[0m[1;36m64[0m[1;39m}[0m[39m and[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2023[0m[39m:represents the entire dissectable width of the bitmask.[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2024[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2025[0m[39m:[0m[32m'header'[0m[39m and [0m[32m'ett'[0m[39m are the hf fields and ett field respectively to create an[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2026:e[0m[39mxpansion that covers the bytes of the bitmask.[0m                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2027[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2028[0m[39m:[0m[32m'fields'[0m[39m is a NULL terminated array of pointers to hf fields representing[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2029[0m[39m:the individual subfields of the bitmask. These fields must either be integers[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2030[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m([0m[39musually of the same byte width as [0m[32m'header'[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m or of the type FT_BOOLEAN.[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2031:Eac[0m[39mh of the entries in [0m[32m'fields'[0m[39m will be dissected as an item under the[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2032[0m[39m:[0m[32m'header'[0m[39m expansion and also IF the field is a boolean and IF it is set to [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m,[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2033[0m[39m:then the name of that boolean field will be printed on the [0m[32m'header'[0m[39m expansion[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2034[0m[39m:line. For integer type subfields that have a value_string defined, the[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2035[0m[39m:matched string from that value_string will be printed on the expansion line[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2036:a[0m[39ms well.[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2037[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2038:E[0m[39mxample: [0m[1;39m([0m[39mfrom the SCSI dissector[0m[1;39m)[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2039[0m[39m:    static int hf_scsi_inq_peripheral;[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2040[0m[39m:    static int hf_scsi_inq_qualifier;[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2041[0m[39m:    static int hf_scsi_inq_devtype;[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2042[0m[39m:    [0m[33m...[0m                                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2043[0m[39m:    static int ett_scsi_inq_peripheral;[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2044[0m[39m:    [0m[33m...[0m                                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2045[0m[39m:    static int * const peripheral_fields[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m = [0m[1;39m{[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2046[0m[39m:        &hf_scsi_inq_qualifier,[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2047[0m[39m:        &hf_scsi_inq_devtype,[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2048[0m[39m:        NULL[0m                                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2049[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m;[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2050[0m[39m:    [0m[33m...[0m                                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2051[0m[39m:    [0m[35m/[0m[39m* Qualifier and DeviceType *[0m[35m/[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2052[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, tvb, offset, hf_scsi_inq_peripheral,[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2053[0m[39m:        ett_scsi_inq_peripheral, peripheral_fields, ENC_BIG_ENDIAN[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2054[0m[39m:    offset += [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m;[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2055[0m[39m:    [0m[33m...[0m                                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2056[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m &hf_scsi_inq_peripheral,[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2057[0m[39m:          [0m[1;39m{[0m[32m"Peripheral"[0m[39m, [0m[32m"scsi.inquiry.peripheral"[0m[39m, FT_UINT8, BASE_HEX,[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2058[0m[39m:           NULL, [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m, NULL, HFILL[0m[1;39m}[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2059[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2060[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m &hf_scsi_inq_qualifier,[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2061[0m[39m:          [0m[1;39m{[0m[32m"Qualifier"[0m[39m, [0m[32m"scsi.inquiry.qualifier"[0m[39m, FT_UINT8, BASE_HEX,[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2062[0m[39m:           VALS [0m[1;39m([0m[39mscsi_qualifier_val[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, [0m[1;36m0xE0[0m[39m, NULL, HFILL[0m[1;39m}[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2063[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2064[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m{[0m[39m &hf_scsi_inq_devtype,[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2065[0m[39m:          [0m[1;39m{[0m[32m"Device Type"[0m[39m, [0m[32m"scsi.inquiry.devtype"[0m[39m, FT_UINT8, BASE_HEX,[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2066[0m[39m:           VALS [0m[1;39m([0m[39mscsi_devtype_val[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, SCSI_DEV_BITS, NULL, HFILL[0m[1;39m}[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2067[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m,[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2068[0m[39m:    [0m[33m...[0m                                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2069[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2070[0m[39m:Which provides very pretty dissection of this one byte bitmask.[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2071[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2072[0m[39m:    Peripheral: [0m[1;36m0x05[0m[39m, Qualifier: Device type is connected to logical unit, [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mDevice Type: CD-ROM[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2073[0m[39m:        [0m[1;36m000[0m[39m. [0m[33m...[0m[39m. = Qualifier: Device type is connected to logical unit [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m0x00[0m[1;39m)[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2074[0m[39m:        [0m[33m...[0m[1;36m0[0m[39m [0m[1;36m0101[0m[39m = Device Type: CD-ROM [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m0x05[0m[1;39m)[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2075[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2076[0m[39m:The [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask_text[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function is an extended version of[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2077[0m[39m:the [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function. In addition, it allows to:[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2078[0m[39m:- Provide a leading text [0m[1;39m([0m[39me.g. [0m[32m"Flags: "[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m that will appear before[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2079[0m[39m:  the comma-separated list of field values[0m                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2080[0m[39m:- Provide a fallback text [0m[1;39m([0m[39me.g. [0m[32m"None"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m that will be appended if[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2081[0m[39m:  no fields warranted a change to the top-level title.[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2082[0m[39m:- Using flags, specify which fields will affect the top-level title.[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2083[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2084[0m[39m:There are the following flags defined:[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2085[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2086[0m[39m:  BMT_NO_APPEND - the title is taken [0m[32m"as-is"[0m[39m from the [0m[32m'name'[0m[39m argument.[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2087[0m[39m:  BMT_NO_INT - only boolean flags are added to the title.[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2088[0m[39m:  BMT_NO_FALSE - boolean flags are only added to the title if they are set.[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2089[0m[39m:  BMT_NO_TFS - only add flag name to the title, do not use true_false_string[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2090[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2091[0m[39m:The [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask_with_flags[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function is an extended version[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2092[0m[39m:of the [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function. It allows using flags to specify[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2093[0m[39m:which fields will affect the top-level title. The flags are the[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2094[0m[39m:same BMT_NO_* flags as used in the [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask_text[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function.[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2095[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2096[0m[39m:The [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m behavior can be obtained by providing[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2097:b[0m[39moth [0m[32m'name'[0m[39m and [0m[32m'fallback'[0m[39m arguments as NULL, and a flags of[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2098[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m([0m[39mBMT_NO_FALSE|BMT_NO_TFS[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2099[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2100[0m[39m:The [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask_len[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m function is intended for protocols where[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2101:b[0m[39mitmask length is permitted to vary, so a length is specified explicitly[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2102:a[0m[39mlong with the bitmask value. USB Video [0m[32m"bmControl"[0m[39m and [0m[32m"bControlSize"[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2103:f[0m[39mields follow this pattern. The primary intent of this is "forward[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2104:c[0m[39mompatibility," enabling an interpreter coded for version M of a structure[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2105[0m[39m:to comprehend fields in version N of the structure, where N > M and[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2106:bC[0m[39montrolSize increases from version M to version N.[0m                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2107[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2108[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask_len[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m is an extended version of [0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2109[0m[39m:that uses an explicitly specified [0m[1;39m([0m[39mrather than inferred[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m length to control[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2110:d[0m[39missection. Because of this, it may encounter two cases that[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2111[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m and [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_bitmask_text[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m may not:[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2112[0m[39m:- A length that exceeds that of the [0m[32m'header'[0m[39m and bitmask subfields.[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2113[0m[39m:  In this case the least-significant bytes of the bitmask are dissected.[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2114[0m[39m:  An expert warning is generated in this case, because the dissection code[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2115[0m[39m:  likely needs to be updated for a new revision of the protocol.[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2116[0m[39m:- A length that is shorter than that of the [0m[32m'header'[0m[39m and bitmask subfields.[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2117[0m[39m:  In this case, subfields whose data is fully present are dissected,[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2118[0m[39m:  and other subfields are not. No warning is generated in this case,[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2119[0m[39m:  because the dissection code is likely for a later revision of the protocol[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2120[0m[39m:  than the packet it was called to interpret.[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2121[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2122[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2123[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_item_set_generated[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2124[0m[39m:--------------------------[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2125[0m[39m:proto_item_set_generated is used to mark fields as not being read from the[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2126:ca[0m[39mptured data directly, but inferred from one or more values.[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2127[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2128[0m[39m:One of the primary uses of this is the presentation of verification of[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2129:c[0m[39mhecksums. Every IP packet has a checksum line, which can present the result[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2130[0m[39m:of the checksum verification, if enabled in the preferences. The result is[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2131[0m[39m:presented as a subtree, where the result is enclosed in square brackets[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2132[0m[39m:indicating a generated field.[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2133[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2134[0m[39m:  Header checksum: [0m[1;36m0x3d42[0m[39m [0m[1;39m[[0m[39mcorrect[0m[1;39m][0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2135[0m[39m:  [0m[1;39m[[0m[39mChecksum Status: Good [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m1[0m[1;39m)[0m[1;39m][0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2136[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2137[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_item_set_hidden[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2138[0m[39m:-----------------------[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2139[0m[39m:proto_item_set_hidden is used to hide fields, which have already been added[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2140[0m[39m:to the tree, from being visible in the displayed tree.[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2141[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2142[0m[39m:NOTE that creating hidden fields is actually quite a bad idea from a UI design[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2143[0m[39m:perspective because the user [0m[1;39m([0m[39msomeone who did not write nor has ever seen the[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2144:c[0m[39mode[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m has no way of knowing that hidden fields are there to be filtered on[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2145[0m[39m:thus defeating the whole purpose of putting them there. A Better Way might[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2146:be[0m[39m to add the fields [0m[1;39m([0m[39mthat might otherwise be hidden[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m to a subtree where they[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2147[0m[39m:won't be seen unless the user opens the subtree--but they can be found if the[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2148[0m[39m:user wants.[0m                                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2149[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2150[0m[39m:One use for hidden fields [0m[1;39m([0m[39mwhich would be better implemented using visible[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2151:f[0m[39mields in a subtree[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m follows: The caller may want a value to be[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2152[0m[39m:included in a tree so that the packet can be filtered on this field, but[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2153[0m[39m:the representation of that field in the tree is not appropriate. An[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2154:e[0m[39mxample is the token-ring routing information field [0m[1;39m([0m[39mRIF[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. The best way[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2155[0m[39m:to show the RIF in a GUI is by a sequence of ring and bridge numbers.[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2156[0m[39m:Rings are [0m[1;36m3[0m[39m-digit hex numbers, and bridges are single hex digits:[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2157[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2158[0m[39m:    RIF: [0m[1;36m001[0m[39m-A-[0m[1;36m013[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m9[0m[39m-C0F-B-[0m[1;36m555[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2159[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2160[0m[39m:In the case of RIF, the programmer should use a field with no value and[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2161[0m[39m:use [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_none_format[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m to build the above representation. The[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2162[0m[39m:programmer can then add the ring and bridge values, one-by-one, with[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2163[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m and hide them with [0m[1;35mproto_item_set_hidden[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m so that the[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2164[0m[39m:user can then filter on or search for a particular ring or bridge. Here's a[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2165[0m[39m:skeleton of how the programmer might code this.[0m                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2166[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2167[0m[39m:    char *rif;[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2168[0m[39m:    rif = [0m[1;35mcreate_rif_string[0m[1;39m([0m[33m...[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2169[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2170[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_none_format[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, hf_tr_rif_label, [0m[33m...[0m[39m, [0m[32m"RIF: %s"[0m[39m, rif[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2171[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2172[0m[39m:    for [0m[1;39m([0m[39mi = [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m; i < num_rings; i++[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2173[0m[39m:        proto_item *pi;[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2174[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2175[0m[39m:        pi = [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, hf_tr_rif_ring, [0m[33m...[0m[39m, ENC_BIG_ENDIAN[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2176[0m[39m:        [0m[1;35mproto_item_set_hidden[0m[1;39m([0m[39mpi[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2177[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2178[0m[39m:    for [0m[1;39m([0m[39mi = [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m; i < num_rings - [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m; i++[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2179[0m[39m:        proto_item *pi;[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2180[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2181[0m[39m:        pi = [0m[1;35mproto_tree_add_item[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtree, hf_tr_rif_bridge, [0m[33m...[0m[39m, ENC_BIG_ENDIAN[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2182[0m[39m:        [0m[1;35mproto_item_set_hidden[0m[1;39m([0m[39mpi[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2183[0m[39m:    [0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2184[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2185[0m[39m:The logical tree has these items:[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2186[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2187[0m[39m:    hf_tr_rif_label, [0m[33mtext[0m[39m=[0m[32m"RIF[0m[32m: 001-A-013-9-C0F-B-555"[0m[39m, value = NONE[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2188[0m[39m:    hf_tr_rif_ring,  hidden, [0m[33mvalue[0m[39m=[0m[1;36m0x001[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2189[0m[39m:    hf_tr_rif_bridge, hidden, [0m[33mvalue[0m[39m=[0m[1;36m0xA[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2190[0m[39m:    hf_tr_rif_ring,  hidden, [0m[33mvalue[0m[39m=[0m[1;36m0x013[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2191[0m[39m:    hf_tr_rif_bridge, hidden, [0m[33mvalue[0m[39m=[0m[1;36m0x9[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2192[0m[39m:    hf_tr_rif_ring,  hidden, [0m[33mvalue[0m[39m=[0m[1;36m0xC0F[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2193[0m[39m:    hf_tr_rif_bridge, hidden, [0m[33mvalue[0m[39m=[0m[1;36m0xB[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2194[0m[39m:    hf_tr_rif_ring,  hidden, [0m[33mvalue[0m[39m=[0m[1;36m0x555[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2195[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2196[0m[39m:GUI or print code will not display the hidden fields, but a display[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2197:f[0m[39milter or [0m[32m"packet grep"[0m[39m routine will still see the values. The possible[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2198:f[0m[39milter is then possible:[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2199[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2200[0m[39m:    tr.rif_ring eq [0m[1;36m0x013[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2201[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2202[0m[39m:proto_item_set_url[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2203[0m[39m:------------------[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2204[0m[39m:proto_item_set_url is used to mark fields as containing a URL. This can only[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2205:be[0m[39m done with fields of type [0m[1;35mFT_STRING[0m[1;39m([0m[39mZ[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m. If these fields are presented they[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2206:a[0m[39mre underlined, as could be done in a browser. These fields are sensitive to[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2207:c[0m[39mlicks as well, launching the configured browser with this URL as parameter.[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2208[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2209:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m6[0m[39m Utility routines.[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2210[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2211:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m6.1[0m[39m val_to_str, val_to_str_const, try_val_to_str and try_val_to_str_idx[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2212[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2213:A[0m[39m dissector may need to convert a value to a string, using a[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2214[0m[39m:[0m[32m'value_string'[0m[39m structure, by hand, rather than by declaring a field with[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2215:a[0m[39mn associated [0m[32m'value_string'[0m[39m structure; this might be used, for example,[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2216[0m[39m:to generate a COL_INFO line for a frame.[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2217[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2218[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mval_to_str[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m handles the most common case:[0m                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2219[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2220[0m[39m:    const char *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2221[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mval_to_str[0m[1;39m([0m[39muint32_t val, const value_string *vs, const char *fmt[0m[1;39m)[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2222[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2223[0m[39m:If the value [0m[32m'val'[0m[39m is found in the [0m[32m'value_string'[0m[39m table pointed to by[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2224[0m[39m:[0m[32m'vs'[0m[39m, [0m[32m'val_to_str'[0m[39m will return the corresponding string; otherwise, it[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2225[0m[39m:will use [0m[32m'fmt'[0m[39m as an [0m[32m'sprintf'[0m[39m-style format, with [0m[32m'val'[0m[39m as an argument,[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2226[0m[39m:to generate a string, and will return a pointer to that string.[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2227[0m[39m:You can use it in a call to generate a COL_INFO line for a frame such as[0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2228[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2229[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mcol_add_fstr[0m[1;39m([0m[39mCOL_INFO, [0m[32m", %s"[0m[39m, [0m[1;35mval_to_str[0m[1;39m([0m[39mval, table, [0m[32m"Unknown %d"[0m[1;39m)[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2230[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2231[0m[39m:If you don't need to display [0m[32m'val'[0m[39m in your fmt string, you can use[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2232[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mval_to_str_const[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m which just takes a string constant instead and returns it[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2233[0m[39m:unmodified when [0m[32m'val'[0m[39m isn't found.[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2234[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2235[0m[39m:If you need to handle the failure case in some custom way, [0m[1;35mtry_val_to_str[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2236[0m[39m:will return NULL if val isn't found:[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2237[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2238[0m[39m:    const char *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2239[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mtry_val_to_str[0m[1;39m([0m[39muint32_t val, const value_string *vs[0m[1;39m)[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2240[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2241[0m[39m:Note that, you must check whether [0m[32m'try_val_to_str[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m[39m returns NULL, and arrange[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2242[0m[39m:that its return value not be dereferenced if it's NULL. [0m[32m'try_val_to_str_idx[0m[32m([0m[32m)[0m[32m'[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2243:be[0m[39mhaves similarly, except it also returns an index into the value_string [0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39marray,[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2244[0m[39m:or [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m if [0m[32m'val'[0m[39m was not found.[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2245[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2246[0m[39m:The *_ext functions are [0m[32m"extended"[0m[39m versions of those already described. They[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2247[0m[39m:should be used for large value-string arrays which contain many entries. They[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2248[0m[39m:implement value to string conversions which will do either a direct access or[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2249:a[0m[39m binary search of the value string array if possible. See[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2250[0m[39m:[0m[32m"Extended Value Strings"[0m[39m under section [0m[1;36m1.6[0m[39m [0m[32m"Constructing the protocol tree"[0m[39m [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mfor[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2251[0m[39m:more information.[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2252[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2253[0m[39m:See epan/value_string.h for detailed information on the various value_string[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2254:f[0m[39munctions.[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2255[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2256[0m[39m:To handle [0m[1;36m64[0m[39m-bit values, there are an equivalent set of functions. These are:[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2257[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2258[0m[39m:    const char *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2259[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mval64_to_str[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst uint64_t val, const val64_string *vs, const char *fmt[0m[1;39m)[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2260[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2261[0m[39m:    const char *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2262[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mval64_to_str_const[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst uint64_t val, const val64_string *vs, const char [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m*unknown_str[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2263[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2264[0m[39m:    const char *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2265[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mtry_val64_to_str[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst uint64_t val, const val64_string *vs[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2266[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2267[0m[39m:    const char *[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2268[0m[39m:    [0m[1;35mtry_val64_to_str_idx[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst uint64_t val, const val64_string *vs, int [0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m*idx[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2269[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2270[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2271:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m6.2[0m[39m rval_to_str, try_rval_to_str and try_rval_to_str_idx[0m                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2272[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2273:A[0m[39m dissector may need to convert a range of values to a string, using a[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2274[0m[39m:[0m[32m'range_string'[0m[39m structure.[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2275[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2276[0m[39m:Most of the same functions exist as with regular value_strings [0m[1;39m([0m[39msee section[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2277:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m6.1[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m except with the names [0m[32m'rval'[0m[39m instead of [0m[32m'val'[0m[39m.[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2278[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2279[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2280:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m7[0m[39m Calling Other Dissectors.[0m                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2281[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2282:A[0m[39ms each dissector completes its portion of the protocol analysis, it[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2283[0m[39m:is expected to create a new tvbuff of type TVBUFF_SUBSET which[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2284:c[0m[39montains the payload portion of the protocol [0m[1;39m([0m[39mthat is, the bytes[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2285[0m[39m:that are relevant to the next dissector[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2286[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2287[0m[39m:To create a new TVBUFF_SUBSET that begins at a specified offset in a[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2288[0m[39m:parent tvbuff, and runs to the end of the parent tvbuff, the routine[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2289[0m[39m:[0m[1;35mtvbuff_new_subset_remaining[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m is used:[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2290[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2291[0m[39m:    next_tvb = [0m[1;35mtvb_new_subset_remaining[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvb, offset[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2292[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2293[0m[39m:Where:[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2294[0m[39m:    tvb is the tvbuff that the dissector has been working on. It[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2295[0m[39m:    can be a tvbuff of any type.[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2296[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2297[0m[39m:    next_tvb is the new TVBUFF_SUBSET.[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2298[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2299[0m[39m:    offset is the byte offset of [0m[32m'tvb'[0m[39m at which the new tvbuff[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2300[0m[39m:    should start. The first byte is the byte at offset [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m.[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2301[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2302[0m[39m:To create a new TVBUFF_SUBSET that begins at a specified offset in a[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2303[0m[39m:parent tvbuff, with a specified number of bytes in the payload, the[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2304[0m[39m:routine [0m[1;35mtvbuff_new_subset_length[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m is used:[0m                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2305[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2306[0m[39m:    next_tvb = [0m[1;35mtvb_new_subset_length[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvb, offset, reported_length[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2307[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2308[0m[39m:Where:[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2309[0m[39m:    tvb is the tvbuff that the dissector has been working on. It[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2310[0m[39m:    can be a tvbuff of any type.[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2311[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2312[0m[39m:    next_tvb is the new TVBUFF_SUBSET.[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2313[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2314[0m[39m:    offset is the byte offset of [0m[32m'tvb'[0m[39m at which the new tvbuff[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2315[0m[39m:    should start. The first byte is the byte at offset [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m.[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2316[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2317[0m[39m:    reported_length is the number of bytes that the current protocol[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2318[0m[39m:    says should be in the payload.[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2319[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2320[0m[39m:In the few cases where the number of bytes available in the new subset[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2321[0m[39m:must be explicitly specified, rather than being calculated based on the[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2322[0m[39m:number of bytes in the payload, the routine [0m[1;35mtvb_new_subset_length_caplen[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2323[0m[39m:is used:[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2324[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2325[0m[39m:    next_tvb = [0m[1;35mtvb_new_subset_length_caplen[0m[1;39m([0m[39mtvb, offset, length, [0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mreported_length[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2326[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2327[0m[39m:Where:[0m                                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2328[0m[39m:    tvb is the tvbuff that the dissector has been working on. It[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2329[0m[39m:    can be a tvbuff of any type.[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2330[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2331[0m[39m:    next_tvb is the new TVBUFF_SUBSET.[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2332[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2333[0m[39m:    offset is the byte offset of [0m[32m'tvb'[0m[39m at which the new tvbuff[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2334[0m[39m:    should start. The first byte is the byte at offset [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m.[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2335[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2336[0m[39m:    length is the number of bytes in the new TVBUFF_SUBSET. A length[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2337[0m[39m:    argument of [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m says to use as many bytes as are available in[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2338[0m[39m:    [0m[32m'tvb'[0m[39m.[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2339[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2340[0m[39m:    reported_length is the number of bytes that the current protocol[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2341[0m[39m:    says should be in the payload. A reported_length of [0m[1;36m-1[0m[39m says that[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2342[0m[39m:    the protocol doesn't say anything about the size of its payload.[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2343[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2344[0m[39m:To call a dissector you need to get the handle of the dissector using[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2345:f[0m[1;35mind_dissector[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, passing it the string name of the dissector. The setting[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2346[0m[39m:of the handle is usually done once at startup during the proto_reg_handoff[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2347:f[0m[39munction within the calling dissector.[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2348[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2349:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m7.1[0m[39m Dissector Tables[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2350[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2351:A[0m[39mnother way to call a subdissector is to setup a dissector table. A dissector[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2352[0m[39m:table is a list of subdissectors grouped by a common identifier [0m[1;39m([0m[39minteger or[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2353[0m[39m:string[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m in a dissector. Subdissectors will register themselves with the [0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mdissector[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2354[0m[39m:table using their unique identifier using one of the following APIs:[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2355[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2356[0m[39m:    void [0m[1;35mdissector_add_uint[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst char *abbrev, const uint32_t pattern,[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2357[0m[39m:                            dissector_handle_t handle[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2358[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2359[0m[39m:    void [0m[1;35mdissector_add_uint_range[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst char *abbrev, struct epan_range [0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m*range,[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2360[0m[39m:                                  dissector_handle_t handle[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2361[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2362[0m[39m:    void [0m[1;35mdissector_add_string[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst char *name, const char *pattern,[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2363[0m[39m:                              dissector_handle_t handle[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2364[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2365[0m[39m:    void [0m[1;35mdissector_add_for_decode_as[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst char *name,[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2366[0m[39m:                                     dissector_handle_t handle[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2367[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2368[0m[39m:    dissector_add_for_decode_as doesn't add a unique identifier in the [0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mdissector[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2369[0m[39m:    table, but it lets the user add it from the command line or, in Wireshark,[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2370[0m[39m:    through the [0m[32m"Decode As"[0m[39m UI.[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2371[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2372[0m[39m:Then when the dissector hits the common identifier field, it will use one of [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mthe[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2373:f[0m[39mollowing APIs to invoke the subdissector:[0m                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2374[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2375[0m[39m:    int [0m[1;35mdissector_try_uint[0m[1;39m([0m[39mdissector_table_t sub_dissectors,[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2376[0m[39m:        const uint32_t uint_val, tvbuff_t *tvb, packet_info *pinfo,[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2377[0m[39m:        proto_tree *tree[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2378[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2379[0m[39m:    int [0m[1;35mdissector_try_uint_with_data[0m[1;39m([0m[39mdissector_table_t sub_dissectors,[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2380[0m[39m:        const uint32_t uint_val, tvbuff_t *tvb, packet_info *pinfo,[0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2381[0m[39m:        proto_tree *tree, const bool add_proto_name, void *data[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2382[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2383[0m[39m:    int [0m[1;35mdissector_try_string_with_data[0m[1;39m([0m[39mdissector_table_t sub_dissectors, const[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mchar *string,[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2384[0m[39m:        tvbuff_t *tvb, packet_info *pinfo, proto_tree *tree, true, void [0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m*data[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2385[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2386[0m[39m:These pass a subset of the remaining packet [0m[1;39m([0m[39mtypically the rest of the[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2387[0m[39m:packet[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m for the dissector table to determine which subdissector is called.[0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2388[0m[39m:This allows dissection of a packet to be expanded outside of dissector without[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2389[0m[39m:having to modify the dissector directly.[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2390[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2391[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2392:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m8[0m[39m Editing CMakeLists.txt to add your dissector.[0m                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2393[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2394[0m[39m:To arrange that your dissector will be built as part of Wireshark, you[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2395[0m[39m:must add the name of the source file for your dissector to the DISSECTOR_SRC[0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2396[0m[39m:section of epan/dissectors/CMakeLists.txt[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2397[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2398[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2399:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m9[0m[39m Using the git source code tree.[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2400[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2401[0m[39m:  See <[0m[4;94mhttps://www.wireshark.org/develop.html[0m[39m>[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2402[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2403[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;92m2404:1[0m[39m.[0m[1;36m10[0m[39m Submitting code for your new dissector.[0m                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2405[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2406[0m[39m:  See <[0m[4;94mhttps://www.wireshark.org/docs/wsdg_html_chunked/ChSrcContribute.html[0m[39m>[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2407[0m[39m:  and <[0m[4;94mhttps://wiki.wireshark.org/Development/SubmittingPatches[0m[39m>.[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2408[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2409[0m[39m:  - VERIFY that your dissector code does not use prohibited or deprecated APIs[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2410[0m[39m:    as follows:[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2411[0m[39m:    perl <wireshark_root>[0m[35m/tools/[0m[95mcheckAPIs.pl[0m[39m <source-[0m[1;35mfilename[0m[1;39m([0m[39ms[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m>[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2412[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2413[0m[39m:  - VERIFY that your dissector code does not contain any header field related[0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2414[0m[39m:    problems:[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2415[0m[39m:    perl <wireshark_root>[0m[35m/tools/[0m[95mcheckhf.pl[0m[39m <source-[0m[1;35mfilename[0m[1;39m([0m[39ms[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m>[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2416[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2417[0m[39m:  - VERIFY that your dissector code does not contain any display filter [0m       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mrelated[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2418[0m[39m:    problems:[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2419[0m[39m:    perl <wireshark_root>[0m[35m/tools/[0m[95mcheckfiltername.pl[0m[39m <source-[0m[1;35mfilename[0m[1;39m([0m[39ms[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m>[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2420[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2421[0m[39m:  - CHECK your dissector with CppCheck [0m[1;39m([0m[4;94mhttp://cppcheck.sourceforge.net/[0m[4;94m)[0m[39m [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39musing[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2422[0m[39m:    Wireshark's customized configuration. This is particularly important on[0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2423[0m[39m:    Windows, since Microsoft's compiler warnings are quite thin:[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2424[0m[39m:    .[0m[35m/tools/cppcheck/[0m[95mcppcheck.sh[0m[39m <source-[0m[1;35mfilename[0m[1;39m([0m[39ms[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m>[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2425[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2426[0m[39m:  - TEST YOUR DISSECTOR BEFORE SUBMITTING IT.[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2427[0m[39m:    Use fuzz-test.sh and/or randpkt against your dissector. These are[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2428[0m[39m:    described at <[0m[4;94mhttps://wiki.wireshark.org/FuzzTesting[0m[39m>.[0m                     [2m                [0m
